マクロ定義

#define IM_NEWLINE   "\n"
 
#define PRId64   "lld"
 
#define PRIu64   "llu"
 
#define IM_MIN(A, B)   (((A) < (B)) ? (A) : (B))
 
#define IM_MAX(A, B)   (((A) >= (B)) ? (A) : (B))
 
#define IM_CLAMP(V, MN, MX)   ((V) < (MN) ? (MN) : (V) > (MX) ? (MX) : (V))
 
#define IMGUI_CDECL
 
#define IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER(section)   do { if (GImGuiDemoMarkerCallback != NULL) GImGuiDemoMarkerCallback(__FILE__, __LINE__, section, GImGuiDemoMarkerCallbackUserData); } while (0)

7614{
7615 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Columns (legacy API)");
7616 bool open = ImGui::TreeNode("Legacy Columns API");
7617 ImGui::SameLine();
7618 HelpMarker("Columns() is an old API! Prefer using the more flexible and powerful BeginTable() API!");
7619 if (!open)
7620 return;
7621
7622 // Basic columns
7623 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Columns (legacy API)/Basic");
7624 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Basic"))
7625 {
7626 ImGui::Text("Without border:");
7627 ImGui::Columns(3, "mycolumns3", false); // 3-ways, no border
7628 ImGui::Separator();
7629 for (int n = 0; n < 14; n++)
7630 {
7631 char label[32];
7632 sprintf(label, "Item %d", n);
7633 if (ImGui::Selectable(label)) {}
7634 //if (ImGui::Button(label, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN,0.0f))) {}
7635 ImGui::NextColumn();
7636 }
7637 ImGui::Columns(1);
7638 ImGui::Separator();
7639
7640 ImGui::Text("With border:");
7641 ImGui::Columns(4, "mycolumns"); // 4-ways, with border
7642 ImGui::Separator();
7643 ImGui::Text("ID"); ImGui::NextColumn();
7644 ImGui::Text("Name"); ImGui::NextColumn();
7645 ImGui::Text("Path"); ImGui::NextColumn();
7646 ImGui::Text("Hovered"); ImGui::NextColumn();
7647 ImGui::Separator();
7648 const char* names[3] = { "One", "Two", "Three" };
7649 const char* paths[3] = { "/path/one", "/path/two", "/path/three" };
7650 static int selected = -1;
7651 for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
7652 {
7653 char label[32];
7654 sprintf(label, "%04d", i);
7655 if (ImGui::Selectable(label, selected == i, ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAllColumns))
7656 selected = i;
7657 bool hovered = ImGui::IsItemHovered();
7658 ImGui::NextColumn();
7659 ImGui::Text(names[i]); ImGui::NextColumn();
7660 ImGui::Text(paths[i]); ImGui::NextColumn();
7661 ImGui::Text("%d", hovered); ImGui::NextColumn();
7662 }
7663 ImGui::Columns(1);
7664 ImGui::Separator();
7665 ImGui::TreePop();
7666 }
7667
7668 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Columns (legacy API)/Borders");
7669 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Borders"))
7670 {
7671 // NB: Future columns API should allow automatic horizontal borders.
7672 static bool h_borders = true;
7673 static bool v_borders = true;
7674 static int columns_count = 4;
7675 const int lines_count = 3;
7676 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 8);
7677 ImGui::DragInt("##columns_count", &columns_count, 0.1f, 2, 10, "%d columns");
7678 if (columns_count < 2)
7679 columns_count = 2;
7680 ImGui::SameLine();
7681 ImGui::Checkbox("horizontal", &h_borders);
7682 ImGui::SameLine();
7683 ImGui::Checkbox("vertical", &v_borders);
7684 ImGui::Columns(columns_count, NULL, v_borders);
7685 for (int i = 0; i < columns_count * lines_count; i++)
7686 {
7687 if (h_borders && ImGui::GetColumnIndex() == 0)
7688 ImGui::Separator();
7689 ImGui::PushID(i);
7690 ImGui::Text("%c%c%c", 'a' + i, 'a' + i, 'a' + i);
7691 ImGui::Text("Width %.2f", ImGui::GetColumnWidth());
7692 ImGui::Text("Avail %.2f", ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x);
7693 ImGui::Text("Offset %.2f", ImGui::GetColumnOffset());
7694 ImGui::Text("Long text that is likely to clip");
7695 ImGui::Button("Button", ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 0.0f));
7696 ImGui::PopID();
7697 ImGui::NextColumn();
7698 }
7699 ImGui::Columns(1);
7700 if (h_borders)
7701 ImGui::Separator();
7702 ImGui::TreePop();
7703 }
7704
7705 // Create multiple items in a same cell before switching to next column

7721 ImGui::NextColumn();

7724 ImGui::Button("Corniflower");

7755 {

7759 ImGui::Columns(10);
7760
7761 // Also demonstrate using clipper for large vertical lists
7762 int ITEMS_COUNT = 2000;
7763 ImGuiListClipper clipper;
7764 clipper.Begin(ITEMS_COUNT);
7765 while (clipper.Step())
7766 {
7767 for (int i = clipper.DisplayStart; i < clipper.DisplayEnd; i++)
7768 for (int j = 0; j < 10; j++)
7769 {
7770 ImGui::Text("Line %d Column %d...", i, j);
7771 ImGui::NextColumn();
7772 }
7773 }
7774 ImGui::Columns(1);
7775 ImGui::EndChild();
7776 ImGui::TreePop();
7777 }
7778
7779 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Columns (legacy API)/Tree");
7780 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tree"))
7781 {
7782 ImGui::Columns(2, "tree", true);
7783 for (int x = 0; x < 3; x++)
7784 {
7785 bool open1 = ImGui::TreeNode((void*)(intptr_t)x, "Node%d", x);
7786 ImGui::NextColumn();
7787 ImGui::Text("Node contents");
7788 ImGui::NextColumn();
7789 if (open1)
7790 {
7791 for (int y = 0; y < 3; y++)
7792 {
7793 bool open2 = ImGui::TreeNode((void*)(intptr_t)y, "Node%d.%d", x, y);
7794 ImGui::NextColumn();
7795 ImGui::Text("Node contents");
7796 if (open2)
7797 {
7798 ImGui::Text("Even more contents");
7799 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tree in column"))
7800 {
7801 ImGui::Text("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog");
7802 ImGui::TreePop();
7803 }

7805 ImGui::NextColumn();
7806 if (open2)
7807 ImGui::TreePop();
7808 }
7809 ImGui::TreePop();
7810 }
7811 }
7812 ImGui::Columns(1);
7813 ImGui::TreePop();
7814 }

◆ DemoWindowInputs()

static void DemoWindowInputs ( )
static

imgui_demo.cpp の 7823 行目に定義があります。

7824{
7825 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs & Focus");
7826 if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Inputs & Focus"))
7827 {
7828 ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
7829
7830 // Display inputs submitted to ImGuiIO
7831 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs & Focus/Inputs");
7832 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(true, ImGuiCond_Once);
7833 bool inputs_opened = ImGui::TreeNode("Inputs");
7834 ImGui::SameLine();
7835 HelpMarker(
7836 "This is a simplified view. See more detailed input state:\n"
7837 "- in 'Tools->Metrics/Debugger->Inputs'.\n"
7838 "- in 'Tools->Debug Log->IO'.");
7839 if (inputs_opened)
7840 {
7841 if (ImGui::IsMousePosValid())
7842 ImGui::Text("Mouse pos: (%g, %g)", io.MousePos.x, io.MousePos.y);
7843 else
7844 ImGui::Text("Mouse pos: <INVALID>");
7845 ImGui::Text("Mouse delta: (%g, %g)", io.MouseDelta.x, io.MouseDelta.y);
7846 ImGui::Text("Mouse down:");
7847 for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.MouseDown); i++) if (ImGui::IsMouseDown(i)) { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("b%d (%.02f secs)", i, io.MouseDownDuration[i]); }
7848 ImGui::Text("Mouse wheel: %.1f", io.MouseWheel);
7849 ImGui::Text("Mouse clicked count:");
7850 for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.MouseDown); i++) if (io.MouseClickedCount[i] > 0) { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("b%d: %d", i, io.MouseClickedCount[i]); }
7851
7852 // We iterate both legacy native range and named ImGuiKey ranges. This is a little unusual/odd but this allows
7853 // displaying the data for old/new backends.
7854 // User code should never have to go through such hoops!
7855 // You can generally iterate between ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN and ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END.
7856 struct funcs { static bool IsLegacyNativeDupe(ImGuiKey) { return false; } };
7857 ImGuiKey start_key = ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN;
7858 ImGui::Text("Keys down:"); for (ImGuiKey key = start_key; key < ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END; key = (ImGuiKey)(key + 1)) { if (funcs::IsLegacyNativeDupe(key) || !ImGui::IsKeyDown(key)) continue; ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text((key < ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN) ? "\"%s\"" : "\"%s\" %d", ImGui::GetKeyName(key), key); }
7859 ImGui::Text("Keys mods: %s%s%s%s", io.KeyCtrl ? "CTRL " : "", io.KeyShift ? "SHIFT " : "", io.KeyAlt ? "ALT " : "", io.KeySuper ? "SUPER " : "");
7860 ImGui::Text("Chars queue:"); for (int i = 0; i < io.InputQueueCharacters.Size; i++) { ImWchar c = io.InputQueueCharacters[i]; ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("\'%c\' (0x%04X)", (c > ' ' && c <= 255) ? (char)c : '?', c); } // FIXME: We should convert 'c' to UTF-8 here but the functions are not public.
7861
7862 ImGui::TreePop();
7863 }
7864
7865 // Display ImGuiIO output flags
7866 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs & Focus/Outputs");
7867 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(true, ImGuiCond_Once);
7868 bool outputs_opened = ImGui::TreeNode("Outputs");
7869 ImGui::SameLine();
7870 HelpMarker(
7871 "The value of io.WantCaptureMouse and io.WantCaptureKeyboard are normally set by Dear ImGui "
7872 "to instruct your application of how to route inputs. Typically, when a value is true, it means "
7873 "Dear ImGui wants the corresponding inputs and we expect the underlying application to ignore them.\n\n"
7874 "The most typical case is: when hovering a window, Dear ImGui set io.WantCaptureMouse to true, "
7875 "and underlying application should ignore mouse inputs (in practice there are many and more subtle "
7876 "rules leading to how those flags are set).");
7877 if (outputs_opened)
7878 {
7879 ImGui::Text("io.WantCaptureMouse: %d", io.WantCaptureMouse);
7880 ImGui::Text("io.WantCaptureMouseUnlessPopupClose: %d", io.WantCaptureMouseUnlessPopupClose);
7881 ImGui::Text("io.WantCaptureKeyboard: %d", io.WantCaptureKeyboard);
7882 ImGui::Text("io.WantTextInput: %d", io.WantTextInput);
7883 ImGui::Text("io.WantSetMousePos: %d", io.WantSetMousePos);
7884 ImGui::Text("io.NavActive: %d, io.NavVisible: %d", io.NavActive, io.NavVisible);
7885
7886 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs & Focus/Outputs/WantCapture override");
7887 if (ImGui::TreeNode("WantCapture override"))
7888 {
7889 HelpMarker(
7890 "Hovering the colored canvas will override io.WantCaptureXXX fields.\n"
7891 "Notice how normally (when set to none), the value of io.WantCaptureKeyboard would be false when hovering "
7892 "and true when clicking.");
7893 static int capture_override_mouse = -1;
7894 static int capture_override_keyboard = -1;
7895 const char* capture_override_desc[] = { "None", "Set to false", "Set to true" };
7896 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 15);
7897 ImGui::SliderInt("SetNextFrameWantCaptureMouse() on hover", &capture_override_mouse, -1, +1, capture_override_desc[capture_override_mouse + 1], ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp);
7898 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 15);
7899 ImGui::SliderInt("SetNextFrameWantCaptureKeyboard() on hover", &capture_override_keyboard, -1, +1, capture_override_desc[capture_override_keyboard + 1], ImGuiSliderFlags_AlwaysClamp);
7900
7901 ImGui::ColorButton("##panel", ImVec4(0.7f, 0.1f, 0.7f, 1.0f), ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop, ImVec2(128.0f, 96.0f)); // Dummy item
7902 if (ImGui::IsItemHovered() && capture_override_mouse != -1)
7903 ImGui::SetNextFrameWantCaptureMouse(capture_override_mouse == 1);
7904 if (ImGui::IsItemHovered() && capture_override_keyboard != -1)
7905 ImGui::SetNextFrameWantCaptureKeyboard(capture_override_keyboard == 1);
7906
7907 ImGui::TreePop();
7908 }
7909 ImGui::TreePop();
7910 }
7911
7912 // Demonstrate using Shortcut() and Routing Policies.
7913 // The general flow is:
7914 // - Code interested in a chord (e.g. "Ctrl+A") declares their intent.
7915 // - Multiple locations may be interested in same chord! Routing helps find a winner.
7916 // - Every frame, we resolve all claims and assign one owner if the modifiers are matching.
7917 // - The lower-level function is 'bool SetShortcutRouting()', returns true when caller got the route.
7918 // - Most of the times, SetShortcutRouting() is not called directly. User mostly calls Shortcut() with routing flags.
7919 // - If you call Shortcut() WITHOUT any routing option, it uses ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused.
7920 // TL;DR: Most uses will simply be:
7921 // - Shortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_A); // Use ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused policy.
7922 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs & Focus/Shortcuts");
7923 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Shortcuts"))
7924 {
7925 static ImGuiInputFlags route_options = ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat;
7926 static ImGuiInputFlags route_type = ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused;
7927 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat", &route_options, ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat);
7928 ImGui::RadioButton("ImGuiInputFlags_RouteActive", &route_type, ImGuiInputFlags_RouteActive);
7929 ImGui::RadioButton("ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused (default)", &route_type, ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused);
7930 ImGui::RadioButton("ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobal", &route_type, ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobal);
7931 ImGui::Indent();
7932 ImGui::BeginDisabled(route_type != ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobal);
7933 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiInputFlags_RouteOverFocused", &route_options, ImGuiInputFlags_RouteOverFocused);
7934 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiInputFlags_RouteOverActive", &route_options, ImGuiInputFlags_RouteOverActive);
7935 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiInputFlags_RouteUnlessBgFocused", &route_options, ImGuiInputFlags_RouteUnlessBgFocused);
7936 ImGui::EndDisabled();
7937 ImGui::Unindent();
7938 ImGui::RadioButton("ImGuiInputFlags_RouteAlways", &route_type, ImGuiInputFlags_RouteAlways);
7939 ImGuiInputFlags flags = route_type | route_options; // Merged flags
7940 if (route_type != ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobal)
7941 flags &= ~(ImGuiInputFlags_RouteOverFocused | ImGuiInputFlags_RouteOverActive | ImGuiInputFlags_RouteUnlessBgFocused);
7942
7943 ImGui::SeparatorText("Using SetNextItemShortcut()");
7944 ImGui::Text("Ctrl+S");
7945 ImGui::SetNextItemShortcut(ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_S, flags | ImGuiInputFlags_Tooltip);
7946 ImGui::Button("Save");
7947 ImGui::Text("Alt+F");
7948 ImGui::SetNextItemShortcut(ImGuiMod_Alt | ImGuiKey_F, flags | ImGuiInputFlags_Tooltip);
7949 static float f = 0.5f;
7950 ImGui::SliderFloat("Factor", &f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
7951
7952 ImGui::SeparatorText("Using Shortcut()");
7953 const float line_height = ImGui::GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing();
7954 const ImGuiKeyChord key_chord = ImGuiMod_Ctrl | ImGuiKey_A;
7955
7956 ImGui::Text("Ctrl+A");
7957 ImGui::Text("IsWindowFocused: %d, Shortcut: %s", ImGui::IsWindowFocused(), ImGui::Shortcut(key_chord, flags) ? "PRESSED" : "...");
7958
7959 ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ChildBg, ImVec4(1.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f, 0.1f));
7960
7961 ImGui::BeginChild("WindowA", ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, line_height * 14), true);
7962 ImGui::Text("Press CTRL+A and see who receives it!");
7963 ImGui::Separator();
7964
7965 // 1: Window polling for CTRL+A
7966 ImGui::Text("(in WindowA)");
7967 ImGui::Text("IsWindowFocused: %d, Shortcut: %s", ImGui::IsWindowFocused(), ImGui::Shortcut(key_chord, flags) ? "PRESSED" : "...");
7968
7969 // 2: InputText also polling for CTRL+A: it always uses _RouteFocused internally (gets priority when active)
7970 // (Commented because the owner-aware version of Shortcut() is still in imgui_internal.h)
7971 //char str[16] = "Press CTRL+A";
7972 //ImGui::Spacing();
7973 //ImGui::InputText("InputTextB", str, IM_ARRAYSIZE(str), ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly);
7974 //ImGuiID item_id = ImGui::GetItemID();
7975 //ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Internal widgets always use _RouteFocused");
7976 //ImGui::Text("IsWindowFocused: %d, Shortcut: %s", ImGui::IsWindowFocused(), ImGui::Shortcut(key_chord, flags, item_id) ? "PRESSED" : "...");
7977
7978 // 3: Dummy child is not claiming the route: focusing them shouldn't steal route away from WindowA
7979 ImGui::BeginChild("ChildD", ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, line_height * 4), true);
7980 ImGui::Text("(in ChildD: not using same Shortcut)");
7981 ImGui::Text("IsWindowFocused: %d", ImGui::IsWindowFocused());
7982 ImGui::EndChild();
7983
7984 // 4: Child window polling for CTRL+A. It is deeper than WindowA and gets priority when focused.
7985 ImGui::BeginChild("ChildE", ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, line_height * 4), true);
7986 ImGui::Text("(in ChildE: using same Shortcut)");
7987 ImGui::Text("IsWindowFocused: %d, Shortcut: %s", ImGui::IsWindowFocused(), ImGui::Shortcut(key_chord, flags) ? "PRESSED" : "...");
7988 ImGui::EndChild();
7989
7990 // 5: In a popup
7991 if (ImGui::Button("Open Popup"))
7992 ImGui::OpenPopup("PopupF");
7993 if (ImGui::BeginPopup("PopupF"))
7994 {
7995 ImGui::Text("(in PopupF)");
7996 ImGui::Text("IsWindowFocused: %d, Shortcut: %s", ImGui::IsWindowFocused(), ImGui::Shortcut(key_chord, flags) ? "PRESSED" : "...");
7997 // (Commented because the owner-aware version of Shortcut() is still in imgui_internal.h)
7998 //ImGui::InputText("InputTextG", str, IM_ARRAYSIZE(str), ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly);
7999 //ImGui::Text("IsWindowFocused: %d, Shortcut: %s", ImGui::IsWindowFocused(), ImGui::Shortcut(key_chord, flags, ImGui::GetItemID()) ? "PRESSED" : "...");
8000 ImGui::EndPopup();
8001 }
8002 ImGui::EndChild();
8003 ImGui::PopStyleColor();
8004
8005 ImGui::TreePop();
8006 }
8007
8008 // Display mouse cursors
8009 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs & Focus/Mouse Cursors");
8010 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Mouse Cursors"))
8011 {
8012 const char* mouse_cursors_names[] = { "Arrow", "TextInput", "ResizeAll", "ResizeNS", "ResizeEW", "ResizeNESW", "ResizeNWSE", "Hand", "Wait", "Progress", "NotAllowed" };
8013 IM_ASSERT(IM_ARRAYSIZE(mouse_cursors_names) == ImGuiMouseCursor_COUNT);
8014
8015 ImGuiMouseCursor current = ImGui::GetMouseCursor();
8016 const char* cursor_name = (current >= ImGuiMouseCursor_Arrow) && (current < ImGuiMouseCursor_COUNT) ? mouse_cursors_names[current] : "N/A";
8017 ImGui::Text("Current mouse cursor = %d: %s", current, cursor_name);
8018 ImGui::BeginDisabled(true);
8019 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("io.BackendFlags: HasMouseCursors", &io.BackendFlags, ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors);
8020 ImGui::EndDisabled();
8021
8022 ImGui::Text("Hover to see mouse cursors:");
8023 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
8024 "Your application can render a different mouse cursor based on what ImGui::GetMouseCursor() returns. "
8025 "If software cursor rendering (io.MouseDrawCursor) is set ImGui will draw the right cursor for you, "
8026 "otherwise your backend needs to handle it.");
8027 for (int i = 0; i < ImGuiMouseCursor_COUNT; i++)
8028 {
8029 char label[32];
8030 sprintf(label, "Mouse cursor %d: %s", i, mouse_cursors_names[i]);
8031 ImGui::Bullet(); ImGui::Selectable(label, false);
8032 if (ImGui::IsItemHovered())
8033 ImGui::SetMouseCursor(i);
8034 }
8035 ImGui::TreePop();
8036 }
8037
8038 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs & Focus/Tabbing");
8039 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tabbing"))
8040 {
8041 ImGui::Text("Use TAB/SHIFT+TAB to cycle through keyboard editable fields.");
8042 static char buf[32] = "hello";
8043 ImGui::InputText("1", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
8044 ImGui::InputText("2", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
8045 ImGui::InputText("3", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
8046 ImGui::PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoTabStop, true);
8047 ImGui::InputText("4 (tab skip)", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
8048 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Item won't be cycled through when using TAB or Shift+Tab.");
8049 ImGui::PopItemFlag();
8050 ImGui::InputText("5", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
8051 ImGui::TreePop();
8052 }
8053
8054 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs & Focus/Focus from code");
8055 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Focus from code"))
8056 {
8057 bool focus_1 = ImGui::Button("Focus on 1"); ImGui::SameLine();
8058 bool focus_2 = ImGui::Button("Focus on 2"); ImGui::SameLine();
8059 bool focus_3 = ImGui::Button("Focus on 3");
8060 int has_focus = 0;
8061 static char buf[128] = "click on a button to set focus";
8062
8063 if (focus_1) ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere();
8064 ImGui::InputText("1", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
8065 if (ImGui::IsItemActive()) has_focus = 1;
8066
8067 if (focus_2) ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere();
8068 ImGui::InputText("2", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
8069 if (ImGui::IsItemActive()) has_focus = 2;
8070
8071 ImGui::PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoTabStop, true);
8072 if (focus_3) ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere();
8073 ImGui::InputText("3 (tab skip)", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
8074 if (ImGui::IsItemActive()) has_focus = 3;
8075 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Item won't be cycled through when using TAB or Shift+Tab.");
8076 ImGui::PopItemFlag();
8077
8078 if (has_focus)
8079 ImGui::Text("Item with focus: %d", has_focus);
8080 else
8081 ImGui::Text("Item with focus: <none>");
8082
8083 // Use >= 0 parameter to SetKeyboardFocusHere() to focus an upcoming item
8084 static float f3[3] = { 0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f };
8085 int focus_ahead = -1;
8086 if (ImGui::Button("Focus on X")) { focus_ahead = 0; } ImGui::SameLine();
8087 if (ImGui::Button("Focus on Y")) { focus_ahead = 1; } ImGui::SameLine();
8088 if (ImGui::Button("Focus on Z")) { focus_ahead = 2; }
8089 if (focus_ahead != -1) ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere(focus_ahead);
8090 ImGui::SliderFloat3("Float3", &f3[0], 0.0f, 1.0f);
8091
8092 ImGui::TextWrapped("NB: Cursor & selection are preserved when refocusing last used item in code.");
8093 ImGui::TreePop();
8094 }
8095
8096 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Inputs & Focus/Dragging");
8097 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Dragging"))
8098 {
8099 ImGui::TextWrapped("You can use ImGui::GetMouseDragDelta(0) to query for the dragged amount on any widget.");
8100 for (int button = 0; button < 3; button++)
8101 {
8102 ImGui::Text("IsMouseDragging(%d):", button);
8103 ImGui::Text(" w/ default threshold: %d,", ImGui::IsMouseDragging(button));
8104 ImGui::Text(" w/ zero threshold: %d,", ImGui::IsMouseDragging(button, 0.0f));
8105 ImGui::Text(" w/ large threshold: %d,", ImGui::IsMouseDragging(button, 20.0f));
8106 }
8107
8108 ImGui::Button("Drag Me");
8109 if (ImGui::IsItemActive())
8110 ImGui::GetForegroundDrawList()->AddLine(io.MouseClickedPos[0], io.MousePos, ImGui::GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Button), 4.0f); // Draw a line between the button and the mouse cursor
8111
8112 // Drag operations gets "unlocked" when the mouse has moved past a certain threshold
8113 // (the default threshold is stored in io.MouseDragThreshold). You can request a lower or higher
8114 // threshold using the second parameter of IsMouseDragging() and GetMouseDragDelta().
8115 ImVec2 value_raw = ImGui::GetMouseDragDelta(0, 0.0f);
8116 ImVec2 value_with_lock_threshold = ImGui::GetMouseDragDelta(0);
8117 ImVec2 mouse_delta = io.MouseDelta;
8118 ImGui::Text("GetMouseDragDelta(0):");
8119 ImGui::Text(" w/ default threshold: (%.1f, %.1f)", value_with_lock_threshold.x, value_with_lock_threshold.y);
8120 ImGui::Text(" w/ zero threshold: (%.1f, %.1f)", value_raw.x, value_raw.y);
8121 ImGui::Text("io.MouseDelta: (%.1f, %.1f)", mouse_delta.x, mouse_delta.y);
8122 ImGui::TreePop();
8123 }
8124 }
8125}

参照元 ImGui::ShowDemoWindow().

4463 // Demonstrate a few extra things
4464 // - Changing ImGuiCol_ChildBg (which is transparent black in default styles)
4465 // - Using SetCursorPos() to position child window (the child window is an item from the POV of parent window)
4466 // You can also call SetNextWindowPos() to position the child window. The parent window will effectively
4467 // layout from this position.
4468 // - Using ImGui::GetItemRectMin/Max() to query the "item" state (because the child window is an item from
4469 // the POV of the parent window). See 'Demo->Querying Status (Edited/Active/Hovered etc.)' for details.
4470 {
4471 static int offset_x = 0;
4472 static bool override_bg_color = true;
4473 static ImGuiChildFlags child_flags = ImGuiChildFlags_Borders | ImGuiChildFlags_ResizeX | ImGuiChildFlags_ResizeY;

4475 ImGui::DragInt("Offset X", &offset_x, 1.0f, -1000, 1000);

4483 if (child_flags & ImGuiChildFlags_FrameStyle)
4484 override_bg_color = false;
4485
4486 ImGui::SetCursorPosX(ImGui::GetCursorPosX() + (float)offset_x);
4487 if (override_bg_color)

4498 ImVec2 child_rect_max = ImGui::GetItemRectMax();

4513 // Use SetNextItemWidth() to set the width of a single upcoming item.
4514 // Use PushItemWidth()/PopItemWidth() to set the width of a group of items.
4515 // In real code use you'll probably want to choose width values that are proportional to your font size
4516 // e.g. Using '20.0f * GetFontSize()' as width instead of '200.0f', etc.

4741 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(

4743 "Lines only composed of text or \"small\" widgets use less vertical space than lines with framed widgets.");

4746 ImGui::Text("KO Blahblah"); ImGui::SameLine();

4748 HelpMarker("Baseline of button will look misaligned with text..");
4749
4750 // If your line starts with text, call AlignTextToFramePadding() to align text to upcoming widgets.
4751 // (because we don't know what's coming after the Text() statement, we need to move the text baseline
4752 // down by FramePadding.y ahead of time)
4753 ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
4754 ImGui::Text("OK Blahblah"); ImGui::SameLine();
4755 ImGui::Button("Some framed item##2"); ImGui::SameLine();
4756 HelpMarker("We call AlignTextToFramePadding() to vertically align the text baseline by +FramePadding.y");

4759 ImGui::Button("TEST##1"); ImGui::SameLine();

4761 ImGui::SmallButton("TEST##2");

4763 // If your line starts with text, call AlignTextToFramePadding() to align text to upcoming widgets.
4764 ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
4765 ImGui::Text("Text aligned to framed item"); ImGui::SameLine();
4766 ImGui::Button("Item##1"); ImGui::SameLine();

4769 ImGui::Button("Item##3");

4812
4813 // Tree
4814 // (here the node appears after a button and has odd intent, so we use ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesNone to disable hierarchy outline)
4815 const float spacing = ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x;
4816 ImGui::Button("Button##1");
4817 ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, spacing);
4818 if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Node##1", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesNone))
4819 {
4820 // Placeholder tree data
4821 for (int i = 0; i < 6; i++)
4822 ImGui::BulletText("Item %d..", i);
4823 ImGui::TreePop();
4824 }
4825
4826 // Vertically align text node a bit lower so it'll be vertically centered with upcoming widget.
4827 // Otherwise you can use SmallButton() (smaller fit).
4828 ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
4829
4830 // Common mistake to avoid: if we want to SameLine after TreeNode we need to do it before we add
4831 // other contents below the node.
4832 bool node_open = ImGui::TreeNode("Node##2");
4833 ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, spacing); ImGui::Button("Button##2");
4834 if (node_open)
4835 {
4836 // Placeholder tree data
4837 for (int i = 0; i < 6; i++)
4838 ImGui::BulletText("Item %d..", i);
4839 ImGui::TreePop();
4840 }
4841
4842 // Bullet
4843 ImGui::Button("Button##3");
4844 ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, spacing);
4845 ImGui::BulletText("Bullet text");
4846
4847 ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
4848 ImGui::BulletText("Node");
4849 ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, spacing); ImGui::Button("Button##4");
4850 ImGui::Unindent();
4851 }
4852
4853 ImGui::TreePop();
4854 }
4855
4856 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Layout/Scrolling");
4857 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Scrolling"))
4858 {
4859 // Vertical scroll functions
4860 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Layout/Scrolling/Vertical");
4861 HelpMarker("Use SetScrollHereY() or SetScrollFromPosY() to scroll to a given vertical position.");
4862
4863 static int track_item = 50;
4864 static bool enable_track = true;
4865 static bool enable_extra_decorations = false;
4866 static float scroll_to_off_px = 0.0f;
4867 static float scroll_to_pos_px = 200.0f;
4868
4869 ImGui::Checkbox("Decoration", &enable_extra_decorations);
4870
4871 ImGui::Checkbox("Track", &enable_track);
4872 ImGui::PushItemWidth(100);
4873 ImGui::SameLine(140); enable_track |= ImGui::DragInt("##item", &track_item, 0.25f, 0, 99, "Item = %d");
4874
4875 bool scroll_to_off = ImGui::Button("Scroll Offset");
4876 ImGui::SameLine(140); scroll_to_off |= ImGui::DragFloat("##off", &scroll_to_off_px, 1.00f, 0, FLT_MAX, "+%.0f px");
4877
4878 bool scroll_to_pos = ImGui::Button("Scroll To Pos");
4879 ImGui::SameLine(140); scroll_to_pos |= ImGui::DragFloat("##pos", &scroll_to_pos_px, 1.00f, -10, FLT_MAX, "X/Y = %.0f px");
4880 ImGui::PopItemWidth();
4881
4882 if (scroll_to_off || scroll_to_pos)
4883 enable_track = false;
4884
4885 ImGuiStyle& style = ImGui::GetStyle();
4886 float child_w = (ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x - 4 * style.ItemSpacing.x) / 5;
4887 if (child_w < 1.0f)
4888 child_w = 1.0f;
4889 ImGui::PushID("##VerticalScrolling");
4890 for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++)
4891 {
4892 if (i > 0) ImGui::SameLine();
4893 ImGui::BeginGroup();
4894 const char* names[] = { "Top", "25%", "Center", "75%", "Bottom" };
4895 ImGui::TextUnformatted(names[i]);
4896
4897 const ImGuiWindowFlags child_flags = enable_extra_decorations ? ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar : 0;
4898 const ImGuiID child_id = ImGui::GetID((void*)(intptr_t)i);
4899 const bool child_is_visible = ImGui::BeginChild(child_id, ImVec2(child_w, 200.0f), ImGuiChildFlags_Borders, child_flags);
4900 if (ImGui::BeginMenuBar())
4901 {
4902 ImGui::TextUnformatted("abc");
4903 ImGui::EndMenuBar();
4904 }
4905 if (scroll_to_off)
4906 ImGui::SetScrollY(scroll_to_off_px);
4907 if (scroll_to_pos)
4908 ImGui::SetScrollFromPosY(ImGui::GetCursorStartPos().y + scroll_to_pos_px, i * 0.25f);
4909 if (child_is_visible) // Avoid calling SetScrollHereY when running with culled items
4910 {
4911 for (int item = 0; item < 100; item++)
4912 {
4913 if (enable_track && item == track_item)
4914 {
4915 ImGui::TextColored(ImVec4(1, 1, 0, 1), "Item %d", item);
4916 ImGui::SetScrollHereY(i * 0.25f); // 0.0f:top, 0.5f:center, 1.0f:bottom
4917 }
4918 else
4919 {
4920 ImGui::Text("Item %d", item);
4921 }
4922 }
4923 }
4924 float scroll_y = ImGui::GetScrollY();
4925 float scroll_max_y = ImGui::GetScrollMaxY();
4926 ImGui::EndChild();
4927 ImGui::Text("%.0f/%.0f", scroll_y, scroll_max_y);
4928 ImGui::EndGroup();
4929 }
4930 ImGui::PopID();
4931
4932 // Horizontal scroll functions
4933 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Layout/Scrolling/Horizontal");
4934 ImGui::Spacing();
4935 HelpMarker(
4936 "Use SetScrollHereX() or SetScrollFromPosX() to scroll to a given horizontal position.\n\n"
4937 "Because the clipping rectangle of most window hides half worth of WindowPadding on the "
4938 "left/right, using SetScrollFromPosX(+1) will usually result in clipped text whereas the "
4939 "equivalent SetScrollFromPosY(+1) wouldn't.");
4940 ImGui::PushID("##HorizontalScrolling");
4941 for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++)
4942 {
4943 float child_height = ImGui::GetTextLineHeight() + style.ScrollbarSize + style.WindowPadding.y * 2.0f;
4944 ImGuiWindowFlags child_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar | (enable_extra_decorations ? ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysVerticalScrollbar : 0);
4945 ImGuiID child_id = ImGui::GetID((void*)(intptr_t)i);
4946 bool child_is_visible = ImGui::BeginChild(child_id, ImVec2(-100, child_height), ImGuiChildFlags_Borders, child_flags);
4947 if (scroll_to_off)
4948 ImGui::SetScrollX(scroll_to_off_px);
4949 if (scroll_to_pos)
4950 ImGui::SetScrollFromPosX(ImGui::GetCursorStartPos().x + scroll_to_pos_px, i * 0.25f);
4951 if (child_is_visible) // Avoid calling SetScrollHereY when running with culled items
4952 {
4953 for (int item = 0; item < 100; item++)
4954 {
4955 if (item > 0)
4956 ImGui::SameLine();
4957 if (enable_track && item == track_item)
4958 {
4959 ImGui::TextColored(ImVec4(1, 1, 0, 1), "Item %d", item);
4960 ImGui::SetScrollHereX(i * 0.25f); // 0.0f:left, 0.5f:center, 1.0f:right
4961 }
4962 else
4963 {
4964 ImGui::Text("Item %d", item);
4965 }
4966 }
4967 }
4968 float scroll_x = ImGui::GetScrollX();
4969 float scroll_max_x = ImGui::GetScrollMaxX();
4970 ImGui::EndChild();
4971 ImGui::SameLine();
4972 const char* names[] = { "Left", "25%", "Center", "75%", "Right" };
4973 ImGui::Text("%s\n%.0f/%.0f", names[i], scroll_x, scroll_max_x);
4974 ImGui::Spacing();
4975 }
4976 ImGui::PopID();
4977
4978 // Miscellaneous Horizontal Scrolling Demo
4979 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Layout/Scrolling/Horizontal (more)");
4980 HelpMarker(
4981 "Horizontal scrolling for a window is enabled via the ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar flag.\n\n"
4982 "You may want to also explicitly specify content width by using SetNextWindowContentWidth() before Begin().");
4983 static int lines = 7;
4984 ImGui::SliderInt("Lines", &lines, 1, 15);
4985 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FrameRounding, 3.0f);
4986 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, ImVec2(2.0f, 1.0f));
4987 ImVec2 scrolling_child_size = ImVec2(0, ImGui::GetFrameHeightWithSpacing() * 7 + 30);
4988 ImGui::BeginChild("scrolling", scrolling_child_size, ImGuiChildFlags_Borders, ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar);
4989 for (int line = 0; line < lines; line++)
4990 {
4991 // Display random stuff. For the sake of this trivial demo we are using basic Button() + SameLine()
4992 // If you want to create your own time line for a real application you may be better off manipulating
4993 // the cursor position yourself, aka using SetCursorPos/SetCursorScreenPos to position the widgets
4994 // yourself. You may also want to use the lower-level ImDrawList API.
4995 int num_buttons = 10 + ((line & 1) ? line * 9 : line * 3);
4996 for (int n = 0; n < num_buttons; n++)
4997 {
4998 if (n > 0) ImGui::SameLine();
4999 ImGui::PushID(n + line * 1000);
5000 char num_buf[16];
5001 sprintf(num_buf, "%d", n);
5002 const char* label = (!(n % 15)) ? "FizzBuzz" : (!(n % 3)) ? "Fizz" : (!(n % 5)) ? "Buzz" : num_buf;
5003 float hue = n * 0.05f;
5004 ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Button, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(hue, 0.6f, 0.6f));
5005 ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ButtonHovered, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(hue, 0.7f, 0.7f));
5006 ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ButtonActive, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(hue, 0.8f, 0.8f));
5007 ImGui::Button(label, ImVec2(40.0f + sinf((float)(line + n)) * 20.0f, 0.0f));
5008 ImGui::PopStyleColor(3);
5009 ImGui::PopID();
5010 }
5011 }
5012 float scroll_x = ImGui::GetScrollX();
5013 float scroll_max_x = ImGui::GetScrollMaxX();
5014 ImGui::EndChild();
5015 ImGui::PopStyleVar(2);
5016 float scroll_x_delta = 0.0f;
5017 ImGui::SmallButton("<<");
5018 if (ImGui::IsItemActive())
5019 scroll_x_delta = -ImGui::GetIO().DeltaTime * 1000.0f;
5020 ImGui::SameLine();
5021 ImGui::Text("Scroll from code"); ImGui::SameLine();
5022 ImGui::SmallButton(">>");
5023 if (ImGui::IsItemActive())
5024 scroll_x_delta = +ImGui::GetIO().DeltaTime * 1000.0f;
5025 ImGui::SameLine();
5026 ImGui::Text("%.0f/%.0f", scroll_x, scroll_max_x);
5027 if (scroll_x_delta != 0.0f)
5028 {
5029 // Demonstrate a trick: you can use Begin to set yourself in the context of another window
5030 // (here we are already out of your child window)
5031 ImGui::BeginChild("scrolling");
5032 ImGui::SetScrollX(ImGui::GetScrollX() + scroll_x_delta);
5033 ImGui::EndChild();
5034 }
5035 ImGui::Spacing();
5036
5037 static bool show_horizontal_contents_size_demo_window = false;
5038 ImGui::Checkbox("Show Horizontal contents size demo window", &show_horizontal_contents_size_demo_window);
5039
5040 if (show_horizontal_contents_size_demo_window)
5041 {
5042 static bool show_h_scrollbar = true;
5043 static bool show_button = true;
5044 static bool show_tree_nodes = true;
5045 static bool show_text_wrapped = false;
5046 static bool show_columns = true;
5047 static bool show_tab_bar = true;
5048 static bool show_child = false;
5049 static bool explicit_content_size = false;
5050 static float contents_size_x = 300.0f;
5051 if (explicit_content_size)
5052 ImGui::SetNextWindowContentSize(ImVec2(contents_size_x, 0.0f));
5053 ImGui::Begin("Horizontal contents size demo window", &show_horizontal_contents_size_demo_window, show_h_scrollbar ? ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar : 0);
5054 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Layout/Scrolling/Horizontal contents size demo window");
5055 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(2, 0));
5056 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, ImVec2(2, 0));
5057 HelpMarker(
5058 "Test how different widgets react and impact the work rectangle growing when horizontal scrolling is enabled.\n\n"
5059 "Use 'Metrics->Tools->Show windows rectangles' to visualize rectangles.");
5060 ImGui::Checkbox("H-scrollbar", &show_h_scrollbar);
5061 ImGui::Checkbox("Button", &show_button); // Will grow contents size (unless explicitly overwritten)
5062 ImGui::Checkbox("Tree nodes", &show_tree_nodes); // Will grow contents size and display highlight over full width
5063 ImGui::Checkbox("Text wrapped", &show_text_wrapped);// Will grow and use contents size
5064 ImGui::Checkbox("Columns", &show_columns); // Will use contents size
5065 ImGui::Checkbox("Tab bar", &show_tab_bar); // Will use contents size
5066 ImGui::Checkbox("Child", &show_child); // Will grow and use contents size
5067 ImGui::Checkbox("Explicit content size", &explicit_content_size);
5068 ImGui::Text("Scroll %.1f/%.1f %.1f/%.1f", ImGui::GetScrollX(), ImGui::GetScrollMaxX(), ImGui::GetScrollY(), ImGui::GetScrollMaxY());
5069 if (explicit_content_size)
5070 {
5071 ImGui::SameLine();
5072 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(100);
5073 ImGui::DragFloat("##csx", &contents_size_x);
5074 ImVec2 p = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
5075 ImGui::GetWindowDrawList()->AddRectFilled(p, ImVec2(p.x + 10, p.y + 10), IM_COL32_WHITE);
5076 ImGui::GetWindowDrawList()->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(p.x + contents_size_x - 10, p.y), ImVec2(p.x + contents_size_x, p.y + 10), IM_COL32_WHITE);
5077 ImGui::Dummy(ImVec2(0, 10));
5078 }
5079 ImGui::PopStyleVar(2);
5080 ImGui::Separator();
5081 if (show_button)
5082 {
5083 ImGui::Button("this is a 300-wide button", ImVec2(300, 0));
5084 }
5085 if (show_tree_nodes)
5086 {
5087 bool open = true;
5088 if (ImGui::TreeNode("this is a tree node"))
5089 {
5090 if (ImGui::TreeNode("another one of those tree node..."))
5091 {
5092 ImGui::Text("Some tree contents");
5093 ImGui::TreePop();
5094 }
5095 ImGui::TreePop();
5096 }
5097 ImGui::CollapsingHeader("CollapsingHeader", &open);
5098 }
5099 if (show_text_wrapped)
5100 {
5101 ImGui::TextWrapped("This text should automatically wrap on the edge of the work rectangle.");
5102 }
5103 if (show_columns)
5104 {
5105 ImGui::Text("Tables:");
5106 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table", 4, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders))
5107 {
5108 for (int n = 0; n < 4; n++)
5109 {
5110 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
5111 ImGui::Text("Width %.2f", ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x);
5112 }
5113 ImGui::EndTable();
5114 }
5115 ImGui::Text("Columns:");
5116 ImGui::Columns(4);
5117 for (int n = 0; n < 4; n++)
5118 {
5119 ImGui::Text("Width %.2f", ImGui::GetColumnWidth());
5120 ImGui::NextColumn();
5121 }
5122 ImGui::Columns(1);
5123 }
5124 if (show_tab_bar && ImGui::BeginTabBar("Hello"))
5125 {
5126 if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("OneOneOne")) { ImGui::EndTabItem(); }
5127 if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("TwoTwoTwo")) { ImGui::EndTabItem(); }
5128 if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("ThreeThreeThree")) { ImGui::EndTabItem(); }
5129 if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("FourFourFour")) { ImGui::EndTabItem(); }
5130 ImGui::EndTabBar();
5131 }
5132 if (show_child)
5133 {
5134 ImGui::BeginChild("child", ImVec2(0, 0), ImGuiChildFlags_Borders);
5135 ImGui::EndChild();
5136 }
5137 ImGui::End();
5138 }
5139
5140 ImGui::TreePop();
5141 }
5142
5143 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Layout/Text Clipping");
5144 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Text Clipping"))
5145 {
5146 static ImVec2 size(100.0f, 100.0f);
5147 static ImVec2 offset(30.0f, 30.0f);
5148 ImGui::DragFloat2("size", (float*)&size, 0.5f, 1.0f, 200.0f, "%.0f");
5149 ImGui::TextWrapped("(Click and drag to scroll)");
5150
5151 HelpMarker(
5152 "(Left) Using ImGui::PushClipRect():\n"
5153 "Will alter ImGui hit-testing logic + ImDrawList rendering.\n"
5154 "(use this if you want your clipping rectangle to affect interactions)\n\n"
5155 "(Center) Using ImDrawList::PushClipRect():\n"
5156 "Will alter ImDrawList rendering only.\n"
5157 "(use this as a shortcut if you are only using ImDrawList calls)\n\n"
5158 "(Right) Using ImDrawList::AddText() with a fine ClipRect:\n"
5159 "Will alter only this specific ImDrawList::AddText() rendering.\n"
5160 "This is often used internally to avoid altering the clipping rectangle and minimize draw calls.");
5161
5162 for (int n = 0; n < 3; n++)
5163 {
5164 if (n > 0)
5165 ImGui::SameLine();
5166
5167 ImGui::PushID(n);
5168 ImGui::InvisibleButton("##canvas", size);
5169 if (ImGui::IsItemActive() && ImGui::IsMouseDragging(ImGuiMouseButton_Left))
5170 {
5171 offset.x += ImGui::GetIO().MouseDelta.x;
5172 offset.y += ImGui::GetIO().MouseDelta.y;
5173 }
5174 ImGui::PopID();
5175 if (!ImGui::IsItemVisible()) // Skip rendering as ImDrawList elements are not clipped.
5176 continue;
5177
5178 const ImVec2 p0 = ImGui::GetItemRectMin();
5179 const ImVec2 p1 = ImGui::GetItemRectMax();
5180 const char* text_str = "Line 1 hello\nLine 2 clip me!";
5181 const ImVec2 text_pos = ImVec2(p0.x + offset.x, p0.y + offset.y);
5182 ImDrawList* draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();
5183 switch (n)
5184 {
5185 case 0:
5186 ImGui::PushClipRect(p0, p1, true);
5187 draw_list->AddRectFilled(p0, p1, IM_COL32(90, 90, 120, 255));
5188 draw_list->AddText(text_pos, IM_COL32_WHITE, text_str);
5189 ImGui::PopClipRect();
5190 break;
5191 case 1:
5192 draw_list->PushClipRect(p0, p1, true);
5193 draw_list->AddRectFilled(p0, p1, IM_COL32(90, 90, 120, 255));
5194 draw_list->AddText(text_pos, IM_COL32_WHITE, text_str);
5195 draw_list->PopClipRect();
5196 break;
5197 case 2:
5198 ImVec4 clip_rect(p0.x, p0.y, p1.x, p1.y); // AddText() takes a ImVec4* here so let's convert.
5199 draw_list->AddRectFilled(p0, p1, IM_COL32(90, 90, 120, 255));
5200 draw_list->AddText(ImGui::GetFont(), ImGui::GetFontSize(), text_pos, IM_COL32_WHITE, text_str, NULL, 0.0f, &clip_rect);
5201 break;
5202 }
5203 }
5204
5205 ImGui::TreePop();
5206 }
5207
5208 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Layout/Overlap Mode");
5209 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Overlap Mode"))
5210 {
5211 static bool enable_allow_overlap = true;
5212
5213 HelpMarker(
5214 "Hit-testing is by default performed in item submission order, which generally is perceived as 'back-to-front'.\n\n"
5215 "By using SetNextItemAllowOverlap() you can notify that an item may be overlapped by another. "
5216 "Doing so alters the hovering logic: items using AllowOverlap mode requires an extra frame to accept hovered state.");
5217 ImGui::Checkbox("Enable AllowOverlap", &enable_allow_overlap);
5218
5219 ImVec2 button1_pos = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
5220 ImVec2 button2_pos = ImVec2(button1_pos.x + 50.0f, button1_pos.y + 50.0f);
5221 if (enable_allow_overlap)
5222 ImGui::SetNextItemAllowOverlap();
5223 ImGui::Button("Button 1", ImVec2(80, 80));
5224 ImGui::SetCursorScreenPos(button2_pos);
5225 ImGui::Button("Button 2", ImVec2(80, 80));
5226
5227 // This is typically used with width-spanning items.
5228 // (note that Selectable() has a dedicated flag ImGuiSelectableFlags_AllowOverlap, which is a shortcut
5229 // for using SetNextItemAllowOverlap(). For demo purpose we use SetNextItemAllowOverlap() here.)
5230 if (enable_allow_overlap)
5231 ImGui::SetNextItemAllowOverlap();
5232 ImGui::Selectable("Some Selectable", false);
5233 ImGui::SameLine();
5234 ImGui::SmallButton("++");
5235
5236 ImGui::TreePop();
5237 }
5238}

被呼び出し関係図:

◆ DemoWindowPopups()

static void DemoWindowPopups ( )
static

imgui_demo.cpp の 5244 行目に定義があります。

5245{
5246 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Popups");
5247 if (!ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Popups & Modal windows"))
5248 return;
5249
5250 // The properties of popups windows are:
5251 // - They block normal mouse hovering detection outside them. (*)
5252 // - Unless modal, they can be closed by clicking anywhere outside them, or by pressing ESCAPE.
5253 // - Their visibility state (~bool) is held internally by Dear ImGui instead of being held by the programmer as
5254 // we are used to with regular Begin() calls. User can manipulate the visibility state by calling OpenPopup().
5255 // (*) One can use IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup) to bypass it and detect hovering even
5256 // when normally blocked by a popup.
5257 // Those three properties are connected. The library needs to hold their visibility state BECAUSE it can close
5258 // popups at any time.
5259
5260 // Typical use for regular windows:
5261 // bool my_tool_is_active = false; if (ImGui::Button("Open")) my_tool_is_active = true; [...] if (my_tool_is_active) Begin("My Tool", &my_tool_is_active) { [...] } End();
5262 // Typical use for popups:
5263 // if (ImGui::Button("Open")) ImGui::OpenPopup("MyPopup"); if (ImGui::BeginPopup("MyPopup") { [...] EndPopup(); }
5264
5265 // With popups we have to go through a library call (here OpenPopup) to manipulate the visibility state.
5266 // This may be a bit confusing at first but it should quickly make sense. Follow on the examples below.
5267
5268 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Popups/Popups");
5269 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Popups"))
5270 {
5271 ImGui::TextWrapped(
5272 "When a popup is active, it inhibits interacting with windows that are behind the popup. "
5273 "Clicking outside the popup closes it.");
5274
5275 static int selected_fish = -1;
5276 const char* names[] = { "Bream", "Haddock", "Mackerel", "Pollock", "Tilefish" };
5277 static bool toggles[] = { true, false, false, false, false };
5278
5279 // Simple selection popup (if you want to show the current selection inside the Button itself,
5280 // you may want to build a string using the "###" operator to preserve a constant ID with a variable label)
5281 if (ImGui::Button("Select.."))
5282 ImGui::OpenPopup("my_select_popup");
5283 ImGui::SameLine();
5284 ImGui::TextUnformatted(selected_fish == -1 ? "<None>" : names[selected_fish]);
5285 if (ImGui::BeginPopup("my_select_popup"))
5286 {
5287 ImGui::SeparatorText("Aquarium");
5288 for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(names); i++)
5289 if (ImGui::Selectable(names[i]))
5290 selected_fish = i;
5291 ImGui::EndPopup();
5292 }
5293
5294 // Showing a menu with toggles
5295 if (ImGui::Button("Toggle.."))
5296 ImGui::OpenPopup("my_toggle_popup");
5297 if (ImGui::BeginPopup("my_toggle_popup"))
5298 {
5299 for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(names); i++)
5300 ImGui::MenuItem(names[i], "", &toggles[i]);
5301 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Sub-menu"))
5302 {
5303 ImGui::MenuItem("Click me");
5304 ImGui::EndMenu();
5305 }
5306
5307 ImGui::Separator();
5308 ImGui::Text("Tooltip here");
5309 ImGui::SetItemTooltip("I am a tooltip over a popup");
5310
5311 if (ImGui::Button("Stacked Popup"))
5312 ImGui::OpenPopup("another popup");
5313 if (ImGui::BeginPopup("another popup"))
5314 {
5315 for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(names); i++)
5316 ImGui::MenuItem(names[i], "", &toggles[i]);
5317 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Sub-menu"))
5318 {
5319 ImGui::MenuItem("Click me");
5320 if (ImGui::Button("Stacked Popup"))
5321 ImGui::OpenPopup("another popup");
5322 if (ImGui::BeginPopup("another popup"))
5323 {
5324 ImGui::Text("I am the last one here.");
5325 ImGui::EndPopup();
5326 }
5327 ImGui::EndMenu();
5328 }
5329 ImGui::EndPopup();
5330 }
5331 ImGui::EndPopup();
5332 }
5333
5334 // Call the more complete ShowExampleMenuFile which we use in various places of this demo
5335 if (ImGui::Button("With a menu.."))
5336 ImGui::OpenPopup("my_file_popup");
5337 if (ImGui::BeginPopup("my_file_popup", ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar))
5338 {
5339 if (ImGui::BeginMenuBar())
5340 {
5341 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("File"))
5342 {
5343 ShowExampleMenuFile();
5344 ImGui::EndMenu();
5345 }
5346 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Edit"))
5347 {
5348 ImGui::MenuItem("Dummy");
5349 ImGui::EndMenu();
5350 }
5351 ImGui::EndMenuBar();
5352 }
5353 ImGui::Text("Hello from popup!");
5354 ImGui::Button("This is a dummy button..");
5355 ImGui::EndPopup();
5356 }
5357
5358 ImGui::TreePop();
5359 }
5360
5361 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Popups/Context menus");
5362 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Context menus"))
5363 {
5364 HelpMarker("\"Context\" functions are simple helpers to associate a Popup to a given Item or Window identifier.");
5365
5366 // BeginPopupContextItem() is a helper to provide common/simple popup behavior of essentially doing:
5367 // if (id == 0)
5368 // id = GetItemID(); // Use last item id
5369 // if (IsItemHovered() && IsMouseReleased(ImGuiMouseButton_Right))
5370 // OpenPopup(id);
5371 // return BeginPopup(id);
5372 // For advanced uses you may want to replicate and customize this code.
5373 // See more details in BeginPopupContextItem().
5374
5375 // Example 1
5376 // When used after an item that has an ID (e.g. Button), we can skip providing an ID to BeginPopupContextItem(),
5377 // and BeginPopupContextItem() will use the last item ID as the popup ID.
5378 {
5379 const char* names[5] = { "Label1", "Label2", "Label3", "Label4", "Label5" };
5380 static int selected = -1;
5381 for (int n = 0; n < 5; n++)
5382 {
5383 if (ImGui::Selectable(names[n], selected == n))
5384 selected = n;
5385 if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem()) // <-- use last item id as popup id
5386 {
5387 selected = n;
5388 ImGui::Text("This a popup for \"%s\"!", names[n]);
5389 if (ImGui::Button("Close"))
5390 ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
5391 ImGui::EndPopup();
5392 }
5393 ImGui::SetItemTooltip("Right-click to open popup");
5394 }
5395 }
5396
5397 // Example 2
5398 // Popup on a Text() element which doesn't have an identifier: we need to provide an identifier to BeginPopupContextItem().
5399 // Using an explicit identifier is also convenient if you want to activate the popups from different locations.
5400 {
5401 HelpMarker("Text() elements don't have stable identifiers so we need to provide one.");
5402 static float value = 0.5f;
5403 ImGui::Text("Value = %.3f <-- (1) right-click this text", value);
5404 if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem("my popup"))
5405 {
5406 if (ImGui::Selectable("Set to zero")) value = 0.0f;
5407 if (ImGui::Selectable("Set to PI")) value = 3.1415f;
5408 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(-FLT_MIN);
5409 ImGui::DragFloat("##Value", &value, 0.1f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
5410 ImGui::EndPopup();
5411 }
5412
5413 // We can also use OpenPopupOnItemClick() to toggle the visibility of a given popup.
5414 // Here we make it that right-clicking this other text element opens the same popup as above.
5415 // The popup itself will be submitted by the code above.
5416 ImGui::Text("(2) Or right-click this text");
5417 ImGui::OpenPopupOnItemClick("my popup", ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight);
5418
5419 // Back to square one: manually open the same popup.
5420 if (ImGui::Button("(3) Or click this button"))
5421 ImGui::OpenPopup("my popup");
5422 }
5423
5424 // Example 3
5425 // When using BeginPopupContextItem() with an implicit identifier (NULL == use last item ID),
5426 // we need to make sure your item identifier is stable.
5427 // In this example we showcase altering the item label while preserving its identifier, using the ### operator (see FAQ).
5428 {
5429 HelpMarker("Showcase using a popup ID linked to item ID, with the item having a changing label + stable ID using the ### operator.");
5430 static char name[32] = "Label1";
5431 char buf[64];
5432 sprintf(buf, "Button: %s###Button", name); // ### operator override ID ignoring the preceding label
5433 ImGui::Button(buf);
5434 if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem())
5435 {
5436 ImGui::Text("Edit name:");
5437 ImGui::InputText("##edit", name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name));
5438 if (ImGui::Button("Close"))
5439 ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
5440 ImGui::EndPopup();
5441 }
5442 ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("(<-- right-click here)");
5443 }
5444
5445 ImGui::TreePop();
5446 }
5447
5448 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Popups/Modals");
5449 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Modals"))
5450 {
5451 ImGui::TextWrapped("Modal windows are like popups but the user cannot close them by clicking outside.");
5452
5453 if (ImGui::Button("Delete.."))
5454 ImGui::OpenPopup("Delete?");
5455
5456 // Always center this window when appearing
5457 ImVec2 center = ImGui::GetMainViewport()->GetCenter();
5458 ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(center, ImGuiCond_Appearing, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
5459
5460 if (ImGui::BeginPopupModal("Delete?", NULL, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
5461 {
5462 ImGui::Text("All those beautiful files will be deleted.\nThis operation cannot be undone!");
5463 ImGui::Separator();
5464
5465 //static int unused_i = 0;
5466 //ImGui::Combo("Combo", &unused_i, "Delete\0Delete harder\0");
5467
5468 static bool dont_ask_me_next_time = false;
5469 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, ImVec2(0, 0));
5470 ImGui::Checkbox("Don't ask me next time", &dont_ask_me_next_time);
5471 ImGui::PopStyleVar();
5472
5473 if (ImGui::Button("OK", ImVec2(120, 0))) { ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup(); }
5474 ImGui::SetItemDefaultFocus();
5475 ImGui::SameLine();
5476 if (ImGui::Button("Cancel", ImVec2(120, 0))) { ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup(); }
5477 ImGui::EndPopup();
5478 }
5479
5480 if (ImGui::Button("Stacked modals.."))
5481 ImGui::OpenPopup("Stacked 1");
5482 if (ImGui::BeginPopupModal("Stacked 1", NULL, ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar))
5483 {
5484 if (ImGui::BeginMenuBar())
5485 {
5486 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("File"))
5487 {
5488 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Some menu item")) {}
5489 ImGui::EndMenu();
5490 }
5491 ImGui::EndMenuBar();
5492 }
5493 ImGui::Text("Hello from Stacked The First\nUsing style.Colors[ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg] behind it.");
5494
5495 // Testing behavior of widgets stacking their own regular popups over the modal.
5496 static int item = 1;
5497 static float color[4] = { 0.4f, 0.7f, 0.0f, 0.5f };
5498 ImGui::Combo("Combo", &item, "aaaa\0bbbb\0cccc\0dddd\0eeee\0\0");
5499 ImGui::ColorEdit4("Color", color);
5500
5501 if (ImGui::Button("Add another modal.."))
5502 ImGui::OpenPopup("Stacked 2");
5503
5504 // Also demonstrate passing a bool* to BeginPopupModal(), this will create a regular close button which
5505 // will close the popup. Note that the visibility state of popups is owned by imgui, so the input value
5506 // of the bool actually doesn't matter here.
5507 bool unused_open = true;
5508 if (ImGui::BeginPopupModal("Stacked 2", &unused_open))
5509 {
5510 ImGui::Text("Hello from Stacked The Second!");
5511 ImGui::ColorEdit4("Color", color); // Allow opening another nested popup
5512 if (ImGui::Button("Close"))
5513 ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
5514 ImGui::EndPopup();
5515 }
5516
5517 if (ImGui::Button("Close"))
5518 ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
5519 ImGui::EndPopup();
5520 }
5521
5522 ImGui::TreePop();
5523 }
5524
5525 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Popups/Menus inside a regular window");
5526 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Menus inside a regular window"))
5527 {
5528 ImGui::TextWrapped("Below we are testing adding menu items to a regular window. It's rather unusual but should work!");
5529 ImGui::Separator();
5530
5531 ImGui::MenuItem("Menu item", "CTRL+M");
5532 if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Menu inside a regular window"))
5533 {
5534 ShowExampleMenuFile();
5535 ImGui::EndMenu();
5536 }
5537 ImGui::Separator();
5538 ImGui::TreePop();
5539 }
5540}

static void DemoWindowTables ( )
static

imgui_demo.cpp の 5708 行目に定義があります。

5709{
5710 //ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(true, ImGuiCond_Once);
5711 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables");
5712 if (!ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Tables & Columns"))
5713 return;
5714
5715 // Using those as a base value to create width/height that are factor of the size of our font
5716 const float TEXT_BASE_WIDTH = ImGui::CalcTextSize("A").x;
5717 const float TEXT_BASE_HEIGHT = ImGui::GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing();
5718
5719 ImGui::PushID("Tables");
5720
5721 int open_action = -1;
5722 if (ImGui::Button("Expand all"))
5723 open_action = 1;
5724 ImGui::SameLine();
5725 if (ImGui::Button("Collapse all"))
5726 open_action = 0;
5727 ImGui::SameLine();
5728
5729 // Options
5730 static bool disable_indent = false;
5731 ImGui::Checkbox("Disable tree indentation", &disable_indent);
5732 ImGui::SameLine();
5733 HelpMarker("Disable the indenting of tree nodes so demo tables can use the full window width.");
5734 ImGui::Separator();
5735 if (disable_indent)
5736 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_IndentSpacing, 0.0f);
5737
5738 // About Styling of tables
5739 // Most settings are configured on a per-table basis via the flags passed to BeginTable() and TableSetupColumns APIs.
5740 // There are however a few settings that a shared and part of the ImGuiStyle structure:
5741 // style.CellPadding // Padding within each cell
5742 // style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TableHeaderBg] // Table header background
5743 // style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TableBorderStrong] // Table outer and header borders
5744 // style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TableBorderLight] // Table inner borders
5745 // style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TableRowBg] // Table row background when ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg is enabled (even rows)
5746 // style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TableRowBgAlt] // Table row background when ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg is enabled (odds rows)
5747
5748 // Demos
5749 if (open_action != -1)
5750 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
5751 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Basic");
5752 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Basic"))
5753 {
5754 // Here we will showcase three different ways to output a table.
5755 // They are very simple variations of a same thing!
5756
5757 // [Method 1] Using TableNextRow() to create a new row, and TableSetColumnIndex() to select the column.
5758 // In many situations, this is the most flexible and easy to use pattern.
5759 HelpMarker("Using TableNextRow() + calling TableSetColumnIndex() _before_ each cell, in a loop.");
5760 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3))
5761 {
5762 for (int row = 0; row < 4; row++)
5763 {
5764 ImGui::TableNextRow();
5765 for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
5766 {
5767 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
5768 ImGui::Text("Row %d Column %d", row, column);
5769 }
5770 }
5771 ImGui::EndTable();
5772 }
5773
5774 // [Method 2] Using TableNextColumn() called multiple times, instead of using a for loop + TableSetColumnIndex().
5775 // This is generally more convenient when you have code manually submitting the contents of each column.
5776 HelpMarker("Using TableNextRow() + calling TableNextColumn() _before_ each cell, manually.");
5777 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table2", 3))
5778 {
5779 for (int row = 0; row < 4; row++)
5780 {
5781 ImGui::TableNextRow();
5782 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
5783 ImGui::Text("Row %d", row);
5784 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
5785 ImGui::Text("Some contents");
5786 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
5787 ImGui::Text("123.456");
5788 }
5789 ImGui::EndTable();
5790 }
5791
5792 // [Method 3] We call TableNextColumn() _before_ each cell. We never call TableNextRow(),
5793 // as TableNextColumn() will automatically wrap around and create new rows as needed.
5794 // This is generally more convenient when your cells all contains the same type of data.
5795 HelpMarker(
5796 "Only using TableNextColumn(), which tends to be convenient for tables where every cell contains "
5797 "the same type of contents.\n This is also more similar to the old NextColumn() function of the "
5798 "Columns API, and provided to facilitate the Columns->Tables API transition.");
5799 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table3", 3))
5800 {
5801 for (int item = 0; item < 14; item++)
5802 {
5803 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
5804 ImGui::Text("Item %d", item);
5805 }
5806 ImGui::EndTable();
5807 }
5808
5809 ImGui::TreePop();
5810 }
5811
5812 if (open_action != -1)
5813 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
5814 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Borders, background");
5815 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Borders, background"))
5816 {
5817 // Expose a few Borders related flags interactively
5818 enum ContentsType { CT_Text, CT_FillButton };
5819 static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_Borders | ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg;
5820 static bool display_headers = false;
5821 static int contents_type = CT_Text;
5822
5823 PushStyleCompact();
5824 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_RowBg);
5825 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Borders", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Borders);
5826 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("ImGuiTableFlags_Borders\n = ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV\n | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV\n | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH\n | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH");
5827 ImGui::Indent();
5828
5829 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersH", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersH);
5830 ImGui::Indent();
5831 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterH);
5832 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerH);
5833 ImGui::Unindent();
5834
5835 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV);
5836 ImGui::Indent();
5837 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuterV);
5838 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInnerV);
5839 ImGui::Unindent();
5840
5841 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter);
5842 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInner", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersInner);
5843 ImGui::Unindent();
5844
5845 ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding(); ImGui::Text("Cell contents:");
5846 ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::RadioButton("Text", &contents_type, CT_Text);
5847 ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::RadioButton("FillButton", &contents_type, CT_FillButton);
5848 ImGui::Checkbox("Display headers", &display_headers);
5849 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_NoBordersInBody); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Disable vertical borders in columns Body (borders will always appear in Headers");
5850 PopStyleCompact();
5851
5852 if (ImGui::BeginTable("table1", 3, flags))
5853 {
5854 // Display headers so we can inspect their interaction with borders
5855 // (Headers are not the main purpose of this section of the demo, so we are not elaborating on them now. See other sections for details)
5856 if (display_headers)
5857 {
5858 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("One");
5859 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Two");
5860 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("Three");
5861 ImGui::TableHeadersRow();
5862 }
5863
5864 for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)
5865 {
5866 ImGui::TableNextRow();
5867 for (int column = 0; column < 3; column++)
5868 {
5869 ImGui::TableSetColumnIndex(column);
5870 char buf[32];
5871 sprintf(buf, "Hello %d,%d", column, row);
5872 if (contents_type == CT_Text)
5873 ImGui::TextUnformatted(buf);
5874 else if (contents_type == CT_FillButton)
5875 ImGui::Button(buf, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 0.0f));
5876 }
5877 }
5878 ImGui::EndTable();
5879 }
5880 ImGui::TreePop();
5881 }
5882
5883 if (open_action != -1)
5884 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(open_action != 0);
5885 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Tables/Resizable, stretch");
5886 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Resizable, stretch"))
5887 {
5888 // By default, if we don't enable ScrollX the sizing policy for each column is "Stretch"
5889 // All columns maintain a sizing weight, and they will occupy all available width.
5890 static ImGuiTableFlags flags = ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame | ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersOuter | ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV | ImGuiTableFlags_ContextMenuInBody;
5891 PushStyleCompact();
5892 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable);
5893 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV", &flags, ImGuiTableFlags_BordersV);
5894 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
5895 "Using the _Resizable flag automatically enables the _BordersInnerV flag as well, "
5896 "this is why the resize borders are still showing when unchecking this.");
5897 PopStyleCompact();
5898

5900 {
5901 for (int row = 0; row < 5; row++)
