3069
3070 // Demonstrate supporting multiple-selection in a tree.
3071 // - We don't use linear indices for selection user data, but our ExampleTreeNode* pointer directly!
3072 // This showcase how SetNextItemSelectionUserData() never assume indices!
3073 // - The difficulty here is to "interpolate" from RangeSrcItem to RangeDstItem in the SetAll/SetRange request.
3074 // We want this interpolation to match what the user sees: in visible order, skipping closed nodes.
3075 // This is implemented by our TreeGetNextNodeInVisibleOrder() user-space helper.
3076 // - Important: In a real codebase aiming to implement full-featured selectable tree with custom filtering, you
3077 // are more likely to build an array mapping sequential indices to visible tree nodes, since your
3078 // filtering/search + clipping process will benefit from it. Having this will make this interpolation much easier.
3079 // - Consider this a prototype: we are working toward simplifying some of it.
3080 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Selection State/Multi-Select (trees)");
3081 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Multi-Select (trees)"))
3082 {
3083 HelpMarker(
3084 "This is rather advanced and experimental. If you are getting started with multi-select, "
3085 "please don't start by looking at how to use it for a tree!\n\n"
3086 "Future versions will try to simplify and formalize some of this.");
3087
3088 struct ExampleTreeFuncs
3089 {
3090 static void DrawNode(ExampleTreeNode* node, ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage* selection)
3091 {
3092 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags tree_node_flags = ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAvailWidth | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick;
3093 tree_node_flags |= ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NavLeftJumpsToParent; // Enable pressing left to jump to parent
3094 if (node->Childs.Size == 0)
3095 tree_node_flags |= ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Bullet | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Leaf;
3096 if (selection->Contains((ImGuiID)node->UID))
3097 tree_node_flags |= ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Selected;
3098
3099 // Using SetNextItemStorageID() to specify storage id, so we can easily peek into
3100 // the storage holding open/close stage, using our TreeNodeGetOpen/TreeNodeSetOpen() functions.
3101 ImGui::SetNextItemSelectionUserData((ImGuiSelectionUserData)(intptr_t)node);
3102 ImGui::SetNextItemStorageID((ImGuiID)node->UID);
3103 if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx(node->Name, tree_node_flags))
3104 {
3105 for (ExampleTreeNode* child : node->Childs)
3106 DrawNode(child, selection);
3107 ImGui::TreePop();
3108 }
3109 else if (ImGui::IsItemToggledOpen())
3110 {
3111 TreeCloseAndUnselectChildNodes(node, selection);
3112 }
3113 }
3114
3115 static bool TreeNodeGetOpen(ExampleTreeNode* node)
3116 {
3117 return ImGui::GetStateStorage()->GetBool((ImGuiID)node->UID);
3118 }
3119
3120 static void TreeNodeSetOpen(ExampleTreeNode* node, bool open)
3121 {
3122 ImGui::GetStateStorage()->SetBool((ImGuiID)node->UID, open);
3123 }
3124
3125 // When closing a node: 1) close and unselect all child nodes, 2) select parent if any child was selected.
3126 // FIXME: This is currently handled by user logic but I'm hoping to eventually provide tree node
3127 // features to do this automatically, e.g. a ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_AutoCloseChildNodes etc.
3128 static int TreeCloseAndUnselectChildNodes(ExampleTreeNode* node, ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage* selection, int depth = 0)
3129 {
3130 // Recursive close (the test for depth == 0 is because we call this on a node that was just closed!)
3131 int unselected_count = selection->Contains((ImGuiID)node->UID) ? 1 : 0;
3132 if (depth == 0 || TreeNodeGetOpen(node))
3133 {
3134 for (ExampleTreeNode* child : node->Childs)
3135 unselected_count += TreeCloseAndUnselectChildNodes(child, selection, depth + 1);
3136 TreeNodeSetOpen(node, false);
3137 }
3138
3139 // Select root node if any of its child was selected, otherwise unselect
3140 selection->SetItemSelected((ImGuiID)node->UID, (depth == 0 && unselected_count > 0));
3141 return unselected_count;
3142 }
3143
3144 // Apply multi-selection requests
3145 static void ApplySelectionRequests(ImGuiMultiSelectIO* ms_io, ExampleTreeNode* tree, ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage* selection)
3146 {
3147 for (ImGuiSelectionRequest& req : ms_io->Requests)
3148 {
3149 if (req.Type == ImGuiSelectionRequestType_SetAll)
3150 {
3151 if (req.Selected)
3152 TreeSetAllInOpenNodes(tree, selection, req.Selected);
3153 else
3154 selection->Clear();
3155 }
3156 else if (req.Type == ImGuiSelectionRequestType_SetRange)
3157 {
3158 ExampleTreeNode* first_node = (ExampleTreeNode*)(intptr_t)req.RangeFirstItem;
3159 ExampleTreeNode* last_node = (ExampleTreeNode*)(intptr_t)req.RangeLastItem;
3160 for (ExampleTreeNode* node = first_node; node != NULL; node = TreeGetNextNodeInVisibleOrder(node, last_node))
3161 selection->SetItemSelected((ImGuiID)node->UID, req.Selected);
3162 }
3163 }
3164 }
3165
3166 static void TreeSetAllInOpenNodes(ExampleTreeNode* node, ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage* selection, bool selected)
3167 {
3168 if (node->Parent != NULL) // Root node isn't visible nor selectable in our scheme
3169 selection->SetItemSelected((ImGuiID)node->UID, selected);
3170 if (node->Parent == NULL || TreeNodeGetOpen(node))
3171 for (ExampleTreeNode* child : node->Childs)
3172 TreeSetAllInOpenNodes(child, selection, selected);
3173 }
3174
3175 // Interpolate in *user-visible order* AND only *over opened nodes*.
3176 // If you have a sequential mapping tables (e.g. generated after a filter/search pass) this would be simpler.
3177 // Here the tricks are that:
3178 // - we store/maintain ExampleTreeNode::IndexInParent which allows implementing a linear iterator easily, without searches, without recursion.
3179 // this could be replaced by a search in parent, aka 'int index_in_parent = curr_node->Parent->Childs.find_index(curr_node)'
3180 // which would only be called when crossing from child to a parent, aka not too much.
3181 // - we call SetNextItemStorageID() before our TreeNode() calls with an ID which doesn't relate to UI stack,
3182 // making it easier to call TreeNodeGetOpen()/TreeNodeSetOpen() from any location.
3183 static ExampleTreeNode* TreeGetNextNodeInVisibleOrder(ExampleTreeNode* curr_node, ExampleTreeNode* last_node)
3184 {
3185 // Reached last node
3186 if (curr_node == last_node)
3187 return NULL;
3188
3189 // Recurse into childs. Query storage to tell if the node is open.
3190 if (curr_node->Childs.Size > 0 && TreeNodeGetOpen(curr_node))
3191 return curr_node->Childs[0];
3192
3193 // Next sibling, then into our own parent
3194 while (curr_node->Parent != NULL)
3195 {
3196 if (curr_node->IndexInParent + 1 < curr_node->Parent->Childs.Size)
3197 return curr_node->Parent->Childs[curr_node->IndexInParent + 1];
3198 curr_node = curr_node->Parent;
3199 }
3200 return NULL;
3201 }
3202
3203 }; // ExampleTreeFuncs
3204
3205 static ImGuiSelectionBasicStorage selection;
3206 if (demo_data->DemoTree == NULL)
3207 demo_data->DemoTree = ExampleTree_CreateDemoTree(); // Create tree once
3208 ImGui::Text("Selection size: %d", selection.Size);
3209
3210 if (ImGui::BeginChild("##Tree", ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, ImGui::GetFontSize() * 20), ImGuiChildFlags_FrameStyle | ImGuiChildFlags_ResizeY))
3211 {
3212 ExampleTreeNode* tree = demo_data->DemoTree;
3213 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags ms_flags = ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ClearOnEscape | ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect2d;
3214 ImGuiMultiSelectIO* ms_io = ImGui::BeginMultiSelect(ms_flags, selection.Size, -1);
3215 ExampleTreeFuncs::ApplySelectionRequests(ms_io, tree, &selection);
3216 for (ExampleTreeNode* node : tree->Childs)
3217 ExampleTreeFuncs::DrawNode(node, &selection);
3218 ms_io = ImGui::EndMultiSelect();
3219 ExampleTreeFuncs::ApplySelectionRequests(ms_io, tree, &selection);
3220 }
3221 ImGui::EndChild();
3222
3223 ImGui::TreePop();
3224 }
3225
3226 // Advanced demonstration of BeginMultiSelect()
3227 // - Showcase clipping.
3228 // - Showcase deletion.
3229 // - Showcase basic drag and drop.
3230 // - Showcase TreeNode variant (note that tree node don't expand in the demo: supporting expanding tree nodes + clipping a separate thing).
3231 // - Showcase using inside a table.
3232 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Selection State/Multi-Select (advanced)");
3233 //ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(true, ImGuiCond_Once);
3234 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Multi-Select (advanced)"))
3235 {
3236 // Options
3237 enum WidgetType { WidgetType_Selectable, WidgetType_TreeNode };
3238 static bool use_clipper = true;
3239 static bool use_deletion = true;
3240 static bool use_drag_drop = true;
3241 static bool show_in_table = false;
3242 static bool show_color_button = true;
3243 static ImGuiMultiSelectFlags flags = ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ClearOnEscape | ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect1d;
3244 static WidgetType widget_type = WidgetType_Selectable;
3245
3246 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Options"))
3247 {
3248 if (ImGui::RadioButton("Selectables", widget_type == WidgetType_Selectable)) { widget_type = WidgetType_Selectable; }
3249 ImGui::SameLine();
3250 if (ImGui::RadioButton("Tree nodes", widget_type == WidgetType_TreeNode)) { widget_type = WidgetType_TreeNode; }
3251 ImGui::SameLine();
3252 HelpMarker("TreeNode() is technically supported but... using this correctly is more complicated (you need some sort of linear/random access to your tree, which is suited to advanced trees setups already implementing filters and clipper. We will work toward simplifying and demoing this.\n\nFor now the tree demo is actually a little bit meaningless because it is an empty tree with only root nodes.");
3253 ImGui::Checkbox("Enable clipper", &use_clipper);
3254 ImGui::Checkbox("Enable deletion", &use_deletion);
3255 ImGui::Checkbox("Enable drag & drop", &use_drag_drop);
3256 ImGui::Checkbox("Show in a table", &show_in_table);
3257 ImGui::Checkbox("Show color button", &show_color_button);
3258 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SingleSelect", &flags, ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SingleSelect);
3259 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoSelectAll", &flags, ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoSelectAll);
3260 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoRangeSelect", &flags, ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoRangeSelect);
3261 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoSelect", &flags, ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoSelect);
3262 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoClear", &flags, ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoClear);
3263 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoClearOnReselect", &flags, ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoClearOnReselect);
3264 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect1d", &flags, ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect1d);
3265 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect2d", &flags, ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect2d);
3266 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelectNoScroll", &flags, ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelectNoScroll);
3267 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ClearOnEscape", &flags, ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ClearOnEscape);
3268 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ClearOnClickVoid", &flags, ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ClearOnClickVoid);
3269 if (ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeWindow", &flags, ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeWindow) && (flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeWindow))
3270 flags &= ~ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeRect;
3271 if (ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeRect", &flags, ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeRect) && (flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeRect))
3272 flags &= ~ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeWindow;
3273 if (ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SelectOnClick", &flags, ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SelectOnClick) && (flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SelectOnClick))
3274 flags &= ~ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SelectOnClickRelease;
3275 if (ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SelectOnClickRelease", &flags, ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SelectOnClickRelease) && (flags & ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SelectOnClickRelease))
3276 flags &= ~ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SelectOnClick;
3277 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Allow dragging an unselected item without altering selection.");
3278 ImGui::TreePop();
3279 }
3280
3281 // Initialize default list with 1000 items.
3282 // Use default selection.Adapter: Pass index to SetNextItemSelectionUserData(), store index in Selection
3283 static ImVector<int> items;
3284 static int items_next_id = 0;
3285 if (items_next_id == 0) { for (int n = 0; n < 1000; n++) { items.push_back(items_next_id++); } }
3286 static ExampleSelectionWithDeletion selection;
3287 static bool request_deletion_from_menu = false; // Queue deletion triggered from context menu
3288
3289 ImGui::Text("Selection size: %d/%d", selection.Size, items.Size);
3290
3291 const float items_height = (widget_type == WidgetType_TreeNode) ? ImGui::GetTextLineHeight() : ImGui::GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing();
3292 ImGui::SetNextWindowContentSize(ImVec2(0.0f, items.Size * items_height));
3293 if (ImGui::BeginChild("##Basket", ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, ImGui::GetFontSize() * 20), ImGuiChildFlags_FrameStyle | ImGuiChildFlags_ResizeY))
3294 {
3295 ImVec2 color_button_sz(ImGui::GetFontSize(), ImGui::GetFontSize());
3296 if (widget_type == WidgetType_TreeNode)
3297 ImGui::PushStyleVarY(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, 0.0f);
3298
3299 ImGuiMultiSelectIO* ms_io = ImGui::BeginMultiSelect(flags, selection.Size, items.Size);
3300 selection.ApplyRequests(ms_io);
3301
3302 const bool want_delete = (ImGui::Shortcut(ImGuiKey_Delete, ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat) && (selection.Size > 0)) || request_deletion_from_menu;
3303 const int item_curr_idx_to_focus = want_delete ? selection.ApplyDeletionPreLoop(ms_io, items.Size) : -1;
3304 request_deletion_from_menu = false;
3305
3306 if (show_in_table)
3307 {
3308 if (widget_type == WidgetType_TreeNode)
3309 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_CellPadding, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f));
3310 ImGui::BeginTable("##Split", 2, ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable | ImGuiTableFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiTableFlags_NoPadOuterX);
3311 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch, 0.70f);
3312 ImGui::TableSetupColumn("", ImGuiTableColumnFlags_WidthStretch, 0.30f);
3313 //ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacingY, 0.0f);
3314 }
3315
3316 ImGuiListClipper clipper;
3317 if (use_clipper)
3318 {
3319 clipper.Begin(items.Size);
3320 if (item_curr_idx_to_focus != -1)
3321 clipper.IncludeItemByIndex(item_curr_idx_to_focus); // Ensure focused item is not clipped.
3322 if (ms_io->RangeSrcItem != -1)
3323 clipper.IncludeItemByIndex((int)ms_io->RangeSrcItem); // Ensure RangeSrc item is not clipped.
3324 }
3325
3326 while (!use_clipper || clipper.Step())
3327 {
3328 const int item_begin = use_clipper ? clipper.DisplayStart : 0;
3329 const int item_end = use_clipper ? clipper.DisplayEnd : items.Size;
3330 for (int n = item_begin; n < item_end; n++)
3331 {
3332 if (show_in_table)
3333 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
3334
3335 const int item_id = items[n];
3336 const char* item_category = ExampleNames[item_id % IM_ARRAYSIZE(ExampleNames)];
3337 char label[64];
3338 sprintf(label, "Object %05d: %s", item_id, item_category);
3339
3340 // IMPORTANT: for deletion refocus to work we need object ID to be stable,
3341 // aka not depend on their index in the list. Here we use our persistent item_id
3342 // instead of index to build a unique ID that will persist.
3343 // (If we used PushID(index) instead, focus wouldn't be restored correctly after deletion).
3344 ImGui::PushID(item_id);
3345
3346 // Emit a color button, to test that Shift+LeftArrow landing on an item that is not part
3347 // of the selection scope doesn't erroneously alter our selection.
3348 if (show_color_button)
3349 {
3350 ImU32 dummy_col = (ImU32)((unsigned int)n * 0xC250B74B) | IM_COL32_A_MASK;
3351 ImGui::ColorButton("##", ImColor(dummy_col), ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip, color_button_sz);
3352 ImGui::SameLine();
3353 }
3354
3355 // Submit item
3356 bool item_is_selected = selection.Contains((ImGuiID)n);
3357 bool item_is_open = false;
3358 ImGui::SetNextItemSelectionUserData(n);
3359 if (widget_type == WidgetType_Selectable)
3360 {
3361 ImGui::Selectable(label, item_is_selected, ImGuiSelectableFlags_None);
3362 }
3363 else if (widget_type == WidgetType_TreeNode)
3364 {
3365 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags tree_node_flags = ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAvailWidth | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick;
3366 if (item_is_selected)
3367 tree_node_flags |= ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Selected;
3368 item_is_open = ImGui::TreeNodeEx(label, tree_node_flags);
3369 }
3370
3371 // Focus (for after deletion)
3372 if (item_curr_idx_to_focus == n)
3373 ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere(-1);
3374
3375 // Drag and Drop
3376 if (use_drag_drop && ImGui::BeginDragDropSource())
3377 {
3378 // Create payload with full selection OR single unselected item.
3379 // (the later is only possible when using ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SelectOnClickRelease)
3380 if (ImGui::GetDragDropPayload() == NULL)
3381 {
3382 ImVector<int> payload_items;
3383 void* it = NULL;
3384 ImGuiID id = 0;
3385 if (!item_is_selected)
3386 payload_items.push_back(item_id);
3387 else
3388 while (selection.GetNextSelectedItem(&it, &id))
3389 payload_items.push_back((int)id);
3390 ImGui::SetDragDropPayload("MULTISELECT_DEMO_ITEMS", payload_items.Data, (size_t)payload_items.size_in_bytes());
3391 }
3392
3393 // Display payload content in tooltip
3394 const ImGuiPayload* payload = ImGui::GetDragDropPayload();
3395 const int* payload_items = (int*)payload->Data;
3396 const int payload_count = (int)payload->DataSize / (int)sizeof(int);
3397 if (payload_count == 1)
3398 ImGui::Text("Object %05d: %s", payload_items[0], ExampleNames[payload_items[0] % IM_ARRAYSIZE(ExampleNames)]);
3399 else
3400 ImGui::Text("Dragging %d objects", payload_count);
3401
3402 ImGui::EndDragDropSource();
3403 }
3404
3405 if (widget_type == WidgetType_TreeNode && item_is_open)
3406 ImGui::TreePop();
3407
3408 // Right-click: context menu
3409 if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem())
3410 {
3411 ImGui::BeginDisabled(!use_deletion || selection.Size == 0);
3412 sprintf(label, "Delete %d item(s)###DeleteSelected", selection.Size);
3413 if (ImGui::Selectable(label))
3414 request_deletion_from_menu = true;
3415 ImGui::EndDisabled();
3416 ImGui::Selectable("Close");
3417 ImGui::EndPopup();
3418 }
3419
3420 // Demo content within a table
3421 if (show_in_table)
3422 {
3423 ImGui::TableNextColumn();
3424 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(-FLT_MIN);
3425 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, ImVec2(0, 0));
3426 ImGui::InputText("###NoLabel", (char*)(void*)item_category, strlen(item_category), ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly);
3427 ImGui::PopStyleVar();
3428 }
3429
3430 ImGui::PopID();
3431 }
3432 if (!use_clipper)
3433 break;
3434 }
3435
3436 if (show_in_table)
3437 {
3438 ImGui::EndTable();
3439 if (widget_type == WidgetType_TreeNode)
3440 ImGui::PopStyleVar();
3441 }
3442
3443 // Apply multi-select requests
3444 ms_io = ImGui::EndMultiSelect();
3445 selection.ApplyRequests(ms_io);
3446 if (want_delete)
3447 selection.ApplyDeletionPostLoop(ms_io, items, item_curr_idx_to_focus);
3448
3449 if (widget_type == WidgetType_TreeNode)
3450 ImGui::PopStyleVar();
3451 }
3452 ImGui::EndChild();
3453 ImGui::TreePop();
3454 }
3455 ImGui::TreePop();
3456 }
3457}

3475 {
3476 ImGui::Text("This is the Avocado tab!\nblah blah blah blah blah");
3477 ImGui::EndTabItem();
3478 }

3495 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Tabs/Advanced & Close Button");
3496 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Advanced & Close Button"))
3497 {
3498 // Expose a couple of the available flags. In most cases you may just call BeginTabBar() with no flags (0).
3499 static ImGuiTabBarFlags tab_bar_flags = ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable;
3500 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable", &tab_bar_flags, ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable);
3501 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTabBarFlags_AutoSelectNewTabs", &tab_bar_flags, ImGuiTabBarFlags_AutoSelectNewTabs);
3502 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTabBarFlags_TabListPopupButton", &tab_bar_flags, ImGuiTabBarFlags_TabListPopupButton);
3503 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton", &tab_bar_flags, ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton);
3504 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTabBarFlags_DrawSelectedOverline", &tab_bar_flags, ImGuiTabBarFlags_DrawSelectedOverline);
3505 if ((tab_bar_flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyMask_) == 0)
3506 tab_bar_flags |= ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyDefault_;
3507 if (ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown", &tab_bar_flags, ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown))
3508 tab_bar_flags &= ~(ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyMask_ ^ ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown);
3509 if (ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll", &tab_bar_flags, ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll))
3510 tab_bar_flags &= ~(ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyMask_ ^ ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll);
3511
3512 // Tab Bar
3513 ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
3514 ImGui::Text("Opened:");
3515 const char* names[4] = { "Artichoke", "Beetroot", "Celery", "Daikon" };
3516 static bool opened[4] = { true, true, true, true }; // Persistent user state
3517 for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(opened); n++)
3518 {
3519 ImGui::SameLine();
3520 ImGui::Checkbox(names[n], &opened[n]);
3521 }
3522
3523 // Passing a bool* to BeginTabItem() is similar to passing one to Begin():
3524 // the underlying bool will be set to false when the tab is closed.
3525 if (ImGui::BeginTabBar("MyTabBar", tab_bar_flags))
3526 {
3527 for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(opened); n++)
3528 if (opened[n] && ImGui::BeginTabItem(names[n], &opened[n], ImGuiTabItemFlags_None))
3529 {
3530 ImGui::Text("This is the %s tab!", names[n]);
3531 if (n & 1)
3532 ImGui::Text("I am an odd tab.");
3533 ImGui::EndTabItem();
3534 }
3535 ImGui::EndTabBar();
3536 }
3537 ImGui::Separator();
3538 ImGui::TreePop();
3539 }
3540
3541 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Tabs/TabItemButton & Leading-Trailing flags");
3542 if (ImGui::TreeNode("TabItemButton & Leading/Trailing flags"))
3543 {
3544 static ImVector<int> active_tabs;
3545 static int next_tab_id = 0;
3546 if (next_tab_id == 0) // Initialize with some default tabs
3547 for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
3548 active_tabs.push_back(next_tab_id++);
3549
3550 // TabItemButton() and Leading/Trailing flags are distinct features which we will demo together.
3551 // (It is possible to submit regular tabs with Leading/Trailing flags, or TabItemButton tabs without Leading/Trailing flags...
3552 // but they tend to make more sense together)
3553 static bool show_leading_button = true;
3554 static bool show_trailing_button = true;
3555 ImGui::Checkbox("Show Leading TabItemButton()", &show_leading_button);
3556 ImGui::Checkbox("Show Trailing TabItemButton()", &show_trailing_button);
3557
3558 // Expose some other flags which are useful to showcase how they interact with Leading/Trailing tabs
3559 static ImGuiTabBarFlags tab_bar_flags = ImGuiTabBarFlags_AutoSelectNewTabs | ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable | ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown;
3560 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTabBarFlags_TabListPopupButton", &tab_bar_flags, ImGuiTabBarFlags_TabListPopupButton);
3561 if (ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown", &tab_bar_flags, ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown))
3562 tab_bar_flags &= ~(ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyMask_ ^ ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown);
3563 if (ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll", &tab_bar_flags, ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll))
3564 tab_bar_flags &= ~(ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyMask_ ^ ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll);
3565
3566 if (ImGui::BeginTabBar("MyTabBar", tab_bar_flags))
3567 {
3568 // Demo a Leading TabItemButton(): click the "?" button to open a menu
3569 if (show_leading_button)
3570 if (ImGui::TabItemButton("?", ImGuiTabItemFlags_Leading | ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoTooltip))
3571 ImGui::OpenPopup("MyHelpMenu");
3572 if (ImGui::BeginPopup("MyHelpMenu"))
3573 {
3574 ImGui::Selectable("Hello!");
3575 ImGui::EndPopup();
3576 }
3577
3578 // Demo Trailing Tabs: click the "+" button to add a new tab.
3579 // (In your app you may want to use a font icon instead of the "+")
3580 // We submit it before the regular tabs, but thanks to the ImGuiTabItemFlags_Trailing flag it will always appear at the end.
3581 if (show_trailing_button)
3582 if (ImGui::TabItemButton("+", ImGuiTabItemFlags_Trailing | ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoTooltip))
3583 active_tabs.push_back(next_tab_id++); // Add new tab
3584
3585 // Submit our regular tabs
3586 for (int n = 0; n < active_tabs.Size; )
3587 {
3588 bool open = true;
3589 char name[16];
3590 snprintf(name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name), "%04d", active_tabs[n]);
3591 if (ImGui::BeginTabItem(name, &open, ImGuiTabItemFlags_None))
3592 {
3593 ImGui::Text("This is the %s tab!", name);
3594 ImGui::EndTabItem();
3595 }
3596
3597 if (!open)
3598 active_tabs.erase(active_tabs.Data + n);
3599 else
3600 n++;
3601 }
3602
3603 ImGui::EndTabBar();
3604 }
3605 ImGui::Separator();
3606 ImGui::TreePop();
3607 }
3608 ImGui::TreePop();
3609 }
3610}

3636 const float global_scale = style.FontScaleMain * style.FontScaleDpi;
3637 ImGui::Text("style.FontScaleMain = %0.2f", style.FontScaleMain);
3638 ImGui::Text("style.FontScaleDpi = %0.2f", style.FontScaleDpi);

3640 ImGui::Text("FontSize = %0.2f", ImGui::GetFontSize());

3643 static float custom_size = 16.0f;

3646 ImGui::PushFont(NULL, custom_size);
3647 ImGui::Text("FontSize = %.2f (== %.2f * global_scale)", ImGui::GetFontSize(), custom_size);
3648 ImGui::PopFont();

3669 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Text/Word Wrapping");
3670 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Word Wrapping"))
3671 {
3672 // Using shortcut. You can use PushTextWrapPos()/PopTextWrapPos() for more flexibility.
3673 ImGui::TextWrapped(
3674 "This text should automatically wrap on the edge of the window. The current implementation "
3675 "for text wrapping follows simple rules suitable for English and possibly other languages.");
3676 ImGui::Spacing();
3677
3678 static float wrap_width = 200.0f;
3679 ImGui::SliderFloat("Wrap width", &wrap_width, -20, 600, "%.0f");
3680
3681 ImDrawList* draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();
3682 for (int n = 0; n < 2; n++)
3683 {
3684 ImGui::Text("Test paragraph %d:", n);
3685 ImVec2 pos = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
3686 ImVec2 marker_min = ImVec2(pos.x + wrap_width, pos.y);
3687 ImVec2 marker_max = ImVec2(pos.x + wrap_width + 10, pos.y + ImGui::GetTextLineHeight());
3688 ImGui::PushTextWrapPos(ImGui::GetCursorPos().x + wrap_width);
3689 if (n == 0)
3690 ImGui::Text("The lazy dog is a good dog. This paragraph should fit within %.0f pixels. Testing a 1 character word. The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.", wrap_width);
3691 else
3692 ImGui::Text("aaaaaaaa bbbbbbbb, c cccccccc,dddddddd. d eeeeeeee ffffffff. gggggggg!hhhhhhhh");
3693
3694 // Draw actual text bounding box, following by marker of our expected limit (should not overlap!)
3695 draw_list->AddRect(ImGui::GetItemRectMin(), ImGui::GetItemRectMax(), IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
3696 draw_list->AddRectFilled(marker_min, marker_max, IM_COL32(255, 0, 255, 255));
3697 ImGui::PopTextWrapPos();
3698 }
3699
3700 ImGui::TreePop();
3701 }
3702
3703 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Text/UTF-8 Text");
3704 if (ImGui::TreeNode("UTF-8 Text"))
3705 {
3706 // UTF-8 test with Japanese characters
3707 // (Needs a suitable font? Try "Google Noto" or "Arial Unicode". See docs/FONTS.md for details.)
3708 // - From C++11 you can use the u8"my text" syntax to encode literal strings as UTF-8
3709 // - For earlier compiler, you may be able to encode your sources as UTF-8 (e.g. in Visual Studio, you
3710 // can save your source files as 'UTF-8 without signature').
3711 // - FOR THIS DEMO FILE ONLY, BECAUSE WE WANT TO SUPPORT OLD COMPILERS, WE ARE *NOT* INCLUDING RAW UTF-8
3712 // CHARACTERS IN THIS SOURCE FILE. Instead we are encoding a few strings with hexadecimal constants.
3713 // Don't do this in your application! Please use u8"text in any language" in your application!
3714 // Note that characters values are preserved even by InputText() if the font cannot be displayed,
3715 // so you can safely copy & paste garbled characters into another application.
3716 ImGui::TextWrapped(
3717 "CJK text will only appear if the font was loaded with the appropriate CJK character ranges. "
3718 "Call io.Fonts->AddFontFromFileTTF() manually to load extra character ranges. "
3719 "Read docs/FONTS.md for details.");
3720 ImGui::Text("Hiragana: \xe3\x81\x8b\xe3\x81\x8d\xe3\x81\x8f\xe3\x81\x91\xe3\x81\x93 (kakikukeko)");
3721 ImGui::Text("Kanjis: \xe6\x97\xa5\xe6\x9c\xac\xe8\xaa\x9e (nihongo)");
3722 static char buf[32] = "\xe6\x97\xa5\xe6\x9c\xac\xe8\xaa\x9e";
3723 //static char buf[32] = u8"NIHONGO"; // <- this is how you would write it with C++11, using real kanjis
3724 ImGui::InputText("UTF-8 input", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
3725 ImGui::TreePop();
3726 }
3727 ImGui::TreePop();
3728 }
3729}

◆ DemoWindowWidgetsTextFilter()

static void DemoWindowWidgetsTextFilter ( )
static

imgui_demo.cpp の 3735 行目に定義があります。

3736{
3737 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Text Filter");
3738 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Text Filter"))
3739 {
3740 // Helper class to easy setup a text filter.
3741 // You may want to implement a more feature-full filtering scheme in your own application.
3742 HelpMarker("Not a widget per-se, but ImGuiTextFilter is a helper to perform simple filtering on text strings.");
3743 static ImGuiTextFilter filter;
3744 ImGui::Text("Filter usage:\n"
3745 " \"\" display all lines\n"
3746 " \"xxx\" display lines containing \"xxx\"\n"
3747 " \"xxx,yyy\" display lines containing \"xxx\" or \"yyy\"\n"
3748 " \"-xxx\" hide lines containing \"xxx\"");
3749 filter.Draw();
3750 const char* lines[] = { "aaa1.c", "bbb1.c", "ccc1.c", "aaa2.cpp", "bbb2.cpp", "ccc2.cpp", "abc.h", "hello, world" };
3751 for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(lines); i++)
3752 if (filter.PassFilter(lines[i]))
3753 ImGui::BulletText("%s", lines[i]);
3754 ImGui::TreePop();
3755 }
3756}

参照先 ImGui::BulletText(), HelpMarker(), IM_ARRAYSIZE, IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER, ImGui::Text(), ImGui::TreeNode(), ImGui::TreePop().

参照元 DemoWindowWidgets().

3763{
3764 // To wire InputText() with std::string or any other custom string type,
3765 // see the "Text Input > Resize Callback" section of this demo, and the misc/cpp/imgui_stdlib.h file.
3766 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Text Input");
3767 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Text Input"))
3768 {
3769 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Text Input/Multi-line Text Input");
3770 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Multi-line Text Input"))
3771 {
3772 // Note: we are using a fixed-sized buffer for simplicity here. See ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize
3773 // and the code in misc/cpp/imgui_stdlib.h for how to setup InputText() for dynamically resizing strings.
3774 static char text[1024 * 16] =
3775 "/*\n"
3776 " The Pentium F00F bug, shorthand for F0 0F C7 C8,\n"
3777 " the hexadecimal encoding of one offending instruction,\n"
3778 " more formally, the invalid operand with locked CMPXCHG8B\n"
3779 " instruction bug, is a design flaw in the majority of\n"
3780 " Intel Pentium, Pentium MMX, and Pentium OverDrive\n"
3781 " processors (all in the P5 microarchitecture).\n"
3782 "*/\n\n"
3783 "label:\n"
3784 "\tlock cmpxchg8b eax\n";
3785
3786 static ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = ImGuiInputTextFlags_AllowTabInput;
3787 HelpMarker("You can use the ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize facility if you need to wire InputTextMultiline() to a dynamic string type. See misc/cpp/imgui_stdlib.h for an example. (This is not demonstrated in imgui_demo.cpp because we don't want to include <string> in here)");
3788 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly", &flags, ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly);
3789 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiInputTextFlags_AllowTabInput", &flags, ImGuiInputTextFlags_AllowTabInput);
3790 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("When _AllowTabInput is set, passing through the widget with Tabbing doesn't automatically activate it, in order to also cycling through subsequent widgets.");
3791 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiInputTextFlags_CtrlEnterForNewLine", &flags, ImGuiInputTextFlags_CtrlEnterForNewLine);
3792 ImGui::InputTextMultiline("##source", text, IM_ARRAYSIZE(text), ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, ImGui::GetTextLineHeight() * 16), flags);
3793 ImGui::TreePop();
3794 }
3795
3796 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Text Input/Filtered Text Input");
3797 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Filtered Text Input"))
3798 {
3799 struct TextFilters
3800 {
3801 // Modify character input by altering 'data->Eventchar' (ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCharFilter callback)
3802 static int FilterCasingSwap(ImGuiInputTextCallbackData* data)
3803 {
3804 if (data->EventChar >= 'a' && data->EventChar <= 'z') { data->EventChar -= 'a' - 'A'; } // Lowercase becomes uppercase
3805 else if (data->EventChar >= 'A' && data->EventChar <= 'Z') { data->EventChar += 'a' - 'A'; } // Uppercase becomes lowercase
3806 return 0;
3807 }
3808
3809 // Return 0 (pass) if the character is 'i' or 'm' or 'g' or 'u' or 'i', otherwise return 1 (filter out)
3810 static int FilterImGuiLetters(ImGuiInputTextCallbackData* data)
3811 {
3812 if (data->EventChar < 256 && strchr("imgui", (char)data->EventChar))
3813 return 0;
3814 return 1;
3815 }
3816 };
3817
3818 static char buf1[32] = ""; ImGui::InputText("default", buf1, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf1));
3819 static char buf2[32] = ""; ImGui::InputText("decimal", buf2, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf2), ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsDecimal);
3820 static char buf3[32] = ""; ImGui::InputText("hexadecimal", buf3, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf3), ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsUppercase);
3821 static char buf4[32] = ""; ImGui::InputText("uppercase", buf4, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf4), ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsUppercase);
3822 static char buf5[32] = ""; ImGui::InputText("no blank", buf5, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf5), ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsNoBlank);
3823 static char buf6[32] = ""; ImGui::InputText("casing swap", buf6, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf6), ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCharFilter, TextFilters::FilterCasingSwap); // Use CharFilter callback to replace characters.
3824 static char buf7[32] = ""; ImGui::InputText("\"imgui\"", buf7, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf7), ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCharFilter, TextFilters::FilterImGuiLetters); // Use CharFilter callback to disable some characters.
3825 ImGui::TreePop();
3826 }
3827
3828 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Text Input/Password input");
3829 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Password Input"))
3830 {
3831 static char password[64] = "password123";
3832 ImGui::InputText("password", password, IM_ARRAYSIZE(password), ImGuiInputTextFlags_Password);
3833 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Display all characters as '*'.\nDisable clipboard cut and copy.\nDisable logging.\n");
3834 ImGui::InputTextWithHint("password (w/ hint)", "<password>", password, IM_ARRAYSIZE(password), ImGuiInputTextFlags_Password);
3835 ImGui::InputText("password (clear)", password, IM_ARRAYSIZE(password));
3836 ImGui::TreePop();
3837 }
3838
3839 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Text Input/Completion, History, Edit Callbacks");
3840 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Completion, History, Edit Callbacks"))
3841 {
3842 struct Funcs
3843 {
3844 static int MyCallback(ImGuiInputTextCallbackData* data)
3845 {
3846 if (data->EventFlag == ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion)
3847 {
3848 data->InsertChars(data->CursorPos, "..");
3849 }
3850 else if (data->EventFlag == ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory)
3851 {
3852 if (data->EventKey == ImGuiKey_UpArrow)
3853 {
3854 data->DeleteChars(0, data->BufTextLen);
3855 data->InsertChars(0, "Pressed Up!");
3856 data->SelectAll();
3857 }
3858 else if (data->EventKey == ImGuiKey_DownArrow)
3859 {
3860 data->DeleteChars(0, data->BufTextLen);
3861 data->InsertChars(0, "Pressed Down!");
3862 data->SelectAll();
3863 }
3864 }
3865 else if (data->EventFlag == ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackEdit)
3866 {
3867 // Toggle casing of first character
3868 char c = data->Buf[0];
3869 if ((c >= 'a' && c <= 'z') || (c >= 'A' && c <= 'Z')) data->Buf[0] ^= 32;
3870 data->BufDirty = true;
3871
3872 // Increment a counter
3873 int* p_int = (int*)data->UserData;
3874 *p_int = *p_int + 1;
3875 }
3876 return 0;
3877 }
3878 };
3879 static char buf1[64];
3880 ImGui::InputText("Completion", buf1, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf1), ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion, Funcs::MyCallback);
3881 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
3882 "Here we append \"..\" each time Tab is pressed. "
3883 "See 'Examples>Console' for a more meaningful demonstration of using this callback.");
3884
3885 static char buf2[64];
3886 ImGui::InputText("History", buf2, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf2), ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory, Funcs::MyCallback);
3887 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
3888 "Here we replace and select text each time Up/Down are pressed. "
3889 "See 'Examples>Console' for a more meaningful demonstration of using this callback.");
3890
3891 static char buf3[64];
3892 static int edit_count = 0;
3893 ImGui::InputText("Edit", buf3, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf3), ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackEdit, Funcs::MyCallback, (void*)&edit_count);
3894 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
3895 "Here we toggle the casing of the first character on every edit + count edits.");
3896 ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("(%d)", edit_count);
3897
3898 ImGui::TreePop();
3899 }
3900
3901 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Text Input/Resize Callback");
3902 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Resize Callback"))
3903 {
3904 // To wire InputText() with std::string or any other custom string type,
3905 // you can use the ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize flag + create a custom ImGui::InputText() wrapper
3906 // using your preferred type. See misc/cpp/imgui_stdlib.h for an implementation of this using std::string.
3907 HelpMarker(
3908 "Using ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize to wire your custom string type to InputText().\n\n"
3909 "See misc/cpp/imgui_stdlib.h for an implementation of this for std::string.");
3910 struct Funcs
3911 {
3912 static int MyResizeCallback(ImGuiInputTextCallbackData* data)
3913 {
3914 if (data->EventFlag == ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize)
3915 {
3916 ImVector<char>* my_str = (ImVector<char>*)data->UserData;
3917 IM_ASSERT(my_str->begin() == data->Buf);
3918 my_str->resize(data->BufSize); // NB: On resizing calls, generally data->BufSize == data->BufTextLen + 1
3919 data->Buf = my_str->begin();
3920 }
3921 return 0;
3922 }
3923
3924 // Note: Because ImGui:: is a namespace you would typically add your own function into the namespace.
3925 // For example, you code may declare a function 'ImGui::InputText(const char* label, MyString* my_str)'
3926 static bool MyInputTextMultiline(const char* label, ImVector<char>* my_str, const ImVec2& size = ImVec2(0, 0), ImGuiInputTextFlags flags = 0)
3927 {
3928 IM_ASSERT((flags & ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize) == 0);
3929 return ImGui::InputTextMultiline(label, my_str->begin(), (size_t)my_str->size(), size, flags | ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackResize, Funcs::MyResizeCallback, (void*)my_str);
3930 }
3931 };
3932
3933 // For this demo we are using ImVector as a string container.
3934 // Note that because we need to store a terminating zero character, our size/capacity are 1 more
3935 // than usually reported by a typical string class.
3936 static ImVector<char> my_str;
3937 if (my_str.empty())
3938 my_str.push_back(0);
3939 Funcs::MyInputTextMultiline("##MyStr", &my_str, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, ImGui::GetTextLineHeight() * 16));
3940 ImGui::Text("Data: %p\nSize: %d\nCapacity: %d", (void*)my_str.begin(), my_str.size(), my_str.capacity());
3941 ImGui::TreePop();
3942 }
3943
3944 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Text Input/Eliding, Alignment");

3946 {

static void DemoWindowWidgetsTooltips ( )

imgui_demo.cpp の 3975 行目に定義があります。

3976{
3977 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Tooltips");
3978 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tooltips"))
3979 {
3980 // Tooltips are windows following the mouse. They do not take focus away.
3981 ImGui::SeparatorText("General");
3982
3983 // Typical use cases:
3984 // - Short-form (text only): SetItemTooltip("Hello");
3985 // - Short-form (any contents): if (BeginItemTooltip()) { Text("Hello"); EndTooltip(); }
3986
3987 // - Full-form (text only): if (IsItemHovered(...)) { SetTooltip("Hello"); }
3988 // - Full-form (any contents): if (IsItemHovered(...) && BeginTooltip()) { Text("Hello"); EndTooltip(); }
3989
3990 HelpMarker(
3991 "Tooltip are typically created by using a IsItemHovered() + SetTooltip() sequence.\n\n"
3992 "We provide a helper SetItemTooltip() function to perform the two with standards flags.");
3993
3994 ImVec2 sz = ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 0.0f);
3995
3996 ImGui::Button("Basic", sz);
3997 ImGui::SetItemTooltip("I am a tooltip");
3998
3999 ImGui::Button("Fancy", sz);
4000 if (ImGui::BeginItemTooltip())
4001 {
4002 ImGui::Text("I am a fancy tooltip");
4003 static float arr[] = { 0.6f, 0.1f, 1.0f, 0.5f, 0.92f, 0.1f, 0.2f };
4004 ImGui::PlotLines("Curve", arr, IM_ARRAYSIZE(arr));
4005 ImGui::Text("Sin(time) = %f", sinf((float)ImGui::GetTime()));
4006 ImGui::EndTooltip();
4007 }
4008
4009 ImGui::SeparatorText("Always On");
4010
4011 // Showcase NOT relying on a IsItemHovered() to emit a tooltip.
4012 // Here the tooltip is always emitted when 'always_on == true'.
4013 static int always_on = 0;
4014 ImGui::RadioButton("Off", &always_on, 0);
4015 ImGui::SameLine();
4016 ImGui::RadioButton("Always On (Simple)", &always_on, 1);
4017 ImGui::SameLine();
4018 ImGui::RadioButton("Always On (Advanced)", &always_on, 2);
4019 if (always_on == 1)
4020 ImGui::SetTooltip("I am following you around.");
4021 else if (always_on == 2 && ImGui::BeginTooltip())
4022 {
4023 ImGui::ProgressBar(sinf((float)ImGui::GetTime()) * 0.5f + 0.5f, ImVec2(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 25, 0.0f));
4024 ImGui::EndTooltip();
4025 }
4026
4027 ImGui::SeparatorText("Custom");
4028
4029 HelpMarker(
4030 "Passing ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip to IsItemHovered() is the preferred way to standardize "
4031 "tooltip activation details across your application. You may however decide to use custom "
4032 "flags for a specific tooltip instance.");
4033
4034 // The following examples are passed for documentation purpose but may not be useful to most users.
4035 // Passing ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip to IsItemHovered() will pull ImGuiHoveredFlags flags values from
4036 // 'style.HoverFlagsForTooltipMouse' or 'style.HoverFlagsForTooltipNav' depending on whether mouse or keyboard/gamepad is being used.
4037 // With default settings, ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip is equivalent to ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayShort + ImGuiHoveredFlags_Stationary.
4038 ImGui::Button("Manual", sz);
4039 if (ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip))
4040 ImGui::SetTooltip("I am a manually emitted tooltip.");
4041
4042 ImGui::Button("DelayNone", sz);
4043 if (ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayNone))
4044 ImGui::SetTooltip("I am a tooltip with no delay.");
4045
4046 ImGui::Button("DelayShort", sz);
4047 if (ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayShort | ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoSharedDelay))
4048 ImGui::SetTooltip("I am a tooltip with a short delay (%0.2f sec).", ImGui::GetStyle().HoverDelayShort);
4049
4050 ImGui::Button("DelayLong", sz);
4051 if (ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayNormal | ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoSharedDelay))
4052 ImGui::SetTooltip("I am a tooltip with a long delay (%0.2f sec).", ImGui::GetStyle().HoverDelayNormal);
4053
4054 ImGui::Button("Stationary", sz);
4055 if (ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_Stationary))
4056 ImGui::SetTooltip("I am a tooltip requiring mouse to be stationary before activating.");
4057
4058 // Using ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip will pull flags from 'style.HoverFlagsForTooltipMouse' or 'style.HoverFlagsForTooltipNav',
4059 // which default value include the ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenDisabled flag.
4060 ImGui::BeginDisabled();
4061 ImGui::Button("Disabled item", sz);
4062 if (ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip))
4063 ImGui::SetTooltip("I am a a tooltip for a disabled item.");
4064 ImGui::EndDisabled();
4065
4066 ImGui::TreePop();
4067 }
4068}

◆ DemoWindowWidgetsTreeNodes()

of the loop. May be a pointer to your own node type, etc.

imgui_demo.cpp の 4074 行目に定義があります。

4075{
4076 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Tree Nodes");
4077 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tree Nodes"))
4078 {
4079 // See see "Examples -> Property Editor" (ShowExampleAppPropertyEditor() function) for a fancier, data-driven tree.
4080 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Tree Nodes/Basic trees");
4081 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Basic trees"))
4082 {
4083 for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++)
4084 {
4085 // Use SetNextItemOpen() so set the default state of a node to be open. We could
4086 // also use TreeNodeEx() with the ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen flag to achieve the same thing!
4087 if (i == 0)
4088 ImGui::SetNextItemOpen(true, ImGuiCond_Once);
4089
4090 // Here we use PushID() to generate a unique base ID, and then the "" used as TreeNode id won't conflict.
4091 // An alternative to using 'PushID() + TreeNode("", ...)' to generate a unique ID is to use 'TreeNode((void*)(intptr_t)i, ...)',
4092 // aka generate a dummy pointer-sized value to be hashed. The demo below uses that technique. Both are fine.
4093 ImGui::PushID(i);
4094 if (ImGui::TreeNode("", "Child %d", i))
4095 {
4096 ImGui::Text("blah blah");
4097 ImGui::SameLine();
4098 if (ImGui::SmallButton("button")) {}
4099 ImGui::TreePop();
4100 }
4101 ImGui::PopID();
4102 }
4103 ImGui::TreePop();
4104 }
4105
4106 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Tree Nodes/Hierarchy lines");
4107 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Hierarchy lines"))
4108 {
4109 static ImGuiTreeNodeFlags base_flags = ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesFull | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DefaultOpen;
4110 HelpMarker("Default option for DrawLinesXXX is stored in style.TreeLinesFlags");
4111 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesNone", &base_flags, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesNone);
4112 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesFull", &base_flags, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesFull);
4113 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesToNodes", &base_flags, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesToNodes);
4114
4115 if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Parent", base_flags))
4116 {
4117 if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Child 1", base_flags))
4118 {
4119 ImGui::Button("Button for Child 1");
4120 ImGui::TreePop();
4121 }
4122 if (ImGui::TreeNodeEx("Child 2", base_flags))
4123 {
4124 ImGui::Button("Button for Child 2");
4125 ImGui::TreePop();
4126 }
4127 ImGui::Text("Remaining contents");
4128 ImGui::Text("Remaining contents");
4129 ImGui::TreePop();
4130 }
4131
4132 ImGui::TreePop();
4133 }
4134
4135 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Widgets/Tree Nodes/Advanced, with Selectable nodes");
4136 if (ImGui::TreeNode("Advanced, with Selectable nodes"))
4137 {
4138 HelpMarker(
4139 "This is a more typical looking tree with selectable nodes.\n"
4140 "Click to select, CTRL+Click to toggle, click on arrows or double-click to open.");
4141 static ImGuiTreeNodeFlags base_flags = ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAvailWidth;
4142 static bool align_label_with_current_x_position = false;
4143 static bool test_drag_and_drop = false;
4144 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow", &base_flags, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow);
4145 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick", &base_flags, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick);
4146 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAvailWidth", &base_flags, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAvailWidth); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Extend hit area to all available width instead of allowing more items to be laid out after the node.");
4147 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth", &base_flags, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanFullWidth);
4148 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanLabelWidth", &base_flags, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanLabelWidth); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Reduce hit area to the text label and a bit of margin.");
4149 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAllColumns", &base_flags, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanAllColumns); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("For use in Tables only.");
4150 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_AllowOverlap", &base_flags, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_AllowOverlap);
4151 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Framed", &base_flags, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Framed); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Draw frame with background (e.g. for CollapsingHeader)");
4152 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NavLeftJumpsToParent", &base_flags, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NavLeftJumpsToParent);
4153
4154 HelpMarker("Default option for DrawLinesXXX is stored in style.TreeLinesFlags");
4155 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesNone", &base_flags, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesNone);
4156 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesFull", &base_flags, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesFull);
4157 ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesToNodes", &base_flags, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesToNodes);
4158
4159 ImGui::Checkbox("Align label with current X position", &align_label_with_current_x_position);
4160 ImGui::Checkbox("Test tree node as drag source", &test_drag_and_drop);
4161 ImGui::Text("Hello!");
4162 if (align_label_with_current_x_position)
4163 ImGui::Unindent(ImGui::GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing());
4164
4165 // 'selection_mask' is dumb representation of what may be user-side selection state.
4166 // You may retain selection state inside or outside your objects in whatever format you see fit.
4167 // 'node_clicked' is temporary storage of what node we have clicked to process selection at the end
4169 static int selection_mask = (1 << 2);
4170 int node_clicked = -1;
4171 for (int i = 0; i < 6; i++)
4172 {
4173 // Disable the default "open on single-click behavior" + set Selected flag according to our selection.
4174 // To alter selection we use IsItemClicked() && !IsItemToggledOpen(), so clicking on an arrow doesn't alter selection.
4175 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags node_flags = base_flags;
4176 const bool is_selected = (selection_mask & (1 << i)) != 0;
4177 if (is_selected)
4178 node_flags |= ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Selected;
4179 if (i < 3)
4180 {
4181 // Items 0..2 are Tree Node
4182 bool node_open = ImGui::TreeNodeEx((void*)(intptr_t)i, node_flags, "Selectable Node %d", i);
4183 if (ImGui::IsItemClicked() && !ImGui::IsItemToggledOpen())
4184 node_clicked = i;
4185 if (test_drag_and_drop && ImGui::BeginDragDropSource())
4186 {
4187 ImGui::SetDragDropPayload("_TREENODE", NULL, 0);
4188 ImGui::Text("This is a drag and drop source");
4189 ImGui::EndDragDropSource();
4190 }
4191 if (i == 2 && (base_flags & ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_SpanLabelWidth))
4192 {
4193 // Item 2 has an additional inline button to help demonstrate SpanLabelWidth.
4194 ImGui::SameLine();
4195 if (ImGui::SmallButton("button")) {}
4196 }
4197 if (node_open)
4198 {
4199 ImGui::BulletText("Blah blah\nBlah Blah");
4200 ImGui::SameLine();
4201 ImGui::SmallButton("Button");
4202 ImGui::TreePop();
4203 }
4204 }
4205 else
4206 {
4207 // Items 3..5 are Tree Leaves
4208 // The only reason we use TreeNode at all is to allow selection of the leaf. Otherwise we can
4209 // use BulletText() or advance the cursor by GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing() and call Text().
4210 node_flags |= ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Leaf | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen; // ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Bullet
4211 ImGui::TreeNodeEx((void*)(intptr_t)i, node_flags, "Selectable Leaf %d", i);
4212 if (ImGui::IsItemClicked() && !ImGui::IsItemToggledOpen())
4213 node_clicked = i;
4214 if (test_drag_and_drop && ImGui::BeginDragDropSource())
4215 {
4216 ImGui::SetDragDropPayload("_TREENODE", NULL, 0);
4217 ImGui::Text("This is a drag and drop source");
4218 ImGui::EndDragDropSource();
4219 }
4220 }
4221 }
4222 if (node_clicked != -1)
4223 {
4224 // Update selection state
4225 // (process outside of tree loop to avoid visual inconsistencies during the clicking frame)
4226 if (ImGui::GetIO().KeyCtrl)
4227 selection_mask ^= (1 << node_clicked); // CTRL+click to toggle
4228 else //if (!(selection_mask & (1 << node_clicked))) // Depending on selection behavior you want, may want to preserve selection when clicking on item that is part of the selection
4229 selection_mask = (1 << node_clicked); // Click to single-select
4230 }
4231 if (align_label_with_current_x_position)
4232 ImGui::Indent(ImGui::GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing());
4233 ImGui::TreePop();
4234 }
4235 ImGui::TreePop();
4236 }
4237}

imgui_demo.cpp の 5630 行目に定義があります。

5631{
5632 struct EnumDesc { ImGuiTableFlags Value; const char* Name; const char* Tooltip; };
5633 static const EnumDesc policies[] =
5634 {
5635 { ImGuiTableFlags_None, "Default", "Use default sizing policy:\n- ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit if ScrollX is on or if host window has ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize.\n- ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame otherwise." },
5636 { ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit, "ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedFit", "Columns default to _WidthFixed (if resizable) or _WidthAuto (if not resizable), matching contents width." },
5637 { ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedSame, "ImGuiTableFlags_SizingFixedSame", "Columns are all the same width, matching the maximum contents width.\nImplicitly disable ImGuiTableFlags_Resizable and enable ImGuiTableFlags_NoKeepColumnsVisible." },
5638 { ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchProp, "ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchProp", "Columns default to _WidthStretch with weights proportional to their widths." },
5639 { ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame, "ImGuiTableFlags_SizingStretchSame", "Columns default to _WidthStretch with same weights." }
5640 };
5641 int idx;
5642 for (idx = 0; idx < IM_ARRAYSIZE(policies); idx++)
5643 if (policies[idx].Value == (*p_flags & ImGuiTableFlags_SizingMask_))
5644 break;
5645 const char* preview_text = (idx < IM_ARRAYSIZE(policies)) ? policies[idx].Name + (idx > 0 ? strlen("ImGuiTableFlags") : 0) : "";
5646 if (ImGui::BeginCombo("Sizing Policy", preview_text))
5647 {
5648 for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(policies); n++)
5649 if (ImGui::Selectable(policies[n].Name, idx == n))
5650 *p_flags = (*p_flags & ~ImGuiTableFlags_SizingMask_) | policies[n].Value;
5651 ImGui::EndCombo();
5652 }
5653 ImGui::SameLine();
5654 ImGui::TextDisabled("(?)");
5655 if (ImGui::BeginItemTooltip())
5656 {
5657 ImGui::PushTextWrapPos(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 50.0f);
5658 for (int m = 0; m < IM_ARRAYSIZE(policies); m++)
5659 {
5660 ImGui::Separator();
5661 ImGui::Text("%s:", policies[m].Name);
5662 ImGui::Separator();
5663 ImGui::SetCursorPosX(ImGui::GetCursorPosX() + ImGui::GetStyle().IndentSpacing * 0.5f);
5664 ImGui::TextUnformatted(policies[m].Tooltip);
5665 }
5666 ImGui::PopTextWrapPos();
5667 ImGui::EndTooltip();
5668 }
5669}

static ExampleTreeNode * ExampleTree_CreateDemoTree ( )
static

imgui_demo.cpp の 851 行目に定義があります。

852{
853 static const char* root_names[] = { "Apple", "Banana", "Cherry", "Kiwi", "Mango", "Orange", "Pear", "Pineapple", "Strawberry", "Watermelon" };
854 const size_t NAME_MAX_LEN = sizeof(ExampleTreeNode::Name);
855 char name_buf[NAME_MAX_LEN];
856 int uid = 0;
857 ExampleTreeNode* node_L0 = ExampleTree_CreateNode("<ROOT>", ++uid, NULL);
858 const int root_items_multiplier = 2;
859 for (int idx_L0 = 0; idx_L0 < IM_ARRAYSIZE(root_names) * root_items_multiplier; idx_L0++)
860 {
861 snprintf(name_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name_buf), "%s %d", root_names[idx_L0 / root_items_multiplier], idx_L0 % root_items_multiplier);
862 ExampleTreeNode* node_L1 = ExampleTree_CreateNode(name_buf, ++uid, node_L0);
863 const int number_of_childs = (int)strlen(node_L1->Name);
864 for (int idx_L1 = 0; idx_L1 < number_of_childs; idx_L1++)
865 {
866 snprintf(name_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name_buf), "Child %d", idx_L1);
867 ExampleTreeNode* node_L2 = ExampleTree_CreateNode(name_buf, ++uid, node_L1);
868 node_L2->HasData = true;
869 if (idx_L1 == 0)
870 {
871 snprintf(name_buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name_buf), "Sub-child %d", 0);
872 ExampleTreeNode* node_L3 = ExampleTree_CreateNode(name_buf, ++uid, node_L2);
873 node_L3->HasData = true;
874 }
875 }
876 }
877 return node_L0;
878}

imgui_demo.cpp の 8341 行目に定義があります。

8342{
8343 if (flags == ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesNone) return "DrawLinesNone";
8344 if (flags == ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesFull) return "DrawLinesFull";
8345 if (flags == ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesToNodes) return "DrawLinesToNodes";
8346 return "";
8347}

参照先 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesFull, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesNone, ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_DrawLinesToNodes.

9658 "Window will resize every-frame to the size of its content.\n"
9659 "Note that you probably don't want to query the window size to\n"
9660 "output your content because that would create a feedback loop.");

◆ ShowExampleAppConstrainedResize()

static void ShowExampleAppConstrainedResize ( bool *  p_open)
static

imgui_demo.cpp の 9673 行目に定義があります。

9674{
9675 struct CustomConstraints
9676 {
9677 // Helper functions to demonstrate programmatic constraints
9678 // FIXME: This doesn't take account of decoration size (e.g. title bar), library should make this easier.
9679 // FIXME: None of the three demos works consistently when resizing from borders.
9680 static void AspectRatio(ImGuiSizeCallbackData* data)
9681 {
9682 float aspect_ratio = *(float*)data->UserData;
9683 data->DesiredSize.y = (float)(int)(data->DesiredSize.x / aspect_ratio);
9684 }
9685 static void Square(ImGuiSizeCallbackData* data)
9686 {
9687 data->DesiredSize.x = data->DesiredSize.y = IM_MAX(data->DesiredSize.x, data->DesiredSize.y);
9688 }
9689 static void Step(ImGuiSizeCallbackData* data)
9690 {
9691 float step = *(float*)data->UserData;
9692 data->DesiredSize = ImVec2((int)(data->DesiredSize.x / step + 0.5f) * step, (int)(data->DesiredSize.y / step + 0.5f) * step);
9693 }
9694 };
9695
9696 const char* test_desc[] =
9697 {
9698 "Between 100x100 and 500x500",
9699 "At least 100x100",
9700 "Resize vertical + lock current width",
9701 "Resize horizontal + lock current height",
9702 "Width Between 400 and 500",
9703 "Height at least 400",
9704 "Custom: Aspect Ratio 16:9",
9705 "Custom: Always Square",
9706 "Custom: Fixed Steps (100)",
9707 };
9708
9709 // Options
9710 static bool auto_resize = false;
9711 static bool window_padding = true;
9712 static int type = 6; // Aspect Ratio
9713 static int display_lines = 10;
9714
9715 // Submit constraint
9716 float aspect_ratio = 16.0f / 9.0f;
9717 float fixed_step = 100.0f;
9718 if (type == 0) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(100, 100), ImVec2(500, 500)); // Between 100x100 and 500x500
9719 if (type == 1) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(100, 100), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX)); // Width > 100, Height > 100
9720 if (type == 2) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(-1, 0), ImVec2(-1, FLT_MAX)); // Resize vertical + lock current width
9721 if (type == 3) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0, -1), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, -1)); // Resize horizontal + lock current height
9722 if (type == 4) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(400, -1), ImVec2(500, -1)); // Width Between and 400 and 500
9723 if (type == 5) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(-1, 400), ImVec2(-1, FLT_MAX)); // Height at least 400
9724 if (type == 6) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX), CustomConstraints::AspectRatio, (void*)&aspect_ratio); // Aspect ratio
9725 if (type == 7) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX), CustomConstraints::Square); // Always Square
9726 if (type == 8) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX), CustomConstraints::Step, (void*)&fixed_step); // Fixed Step
9727
9728 // Submit window
9729 if (!window_padding)
9730 ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f));
9731 const ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = auto_resize ? ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize : 0;
9732 const bool window_open = ImGui::Begin("Example: Constrained Resize", p_open, window_flags);
9733 if (!window_padding)
9734 ImGui::PopStyleVar();
9735 if (window_open)
9736 {
9737 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Constrained Resizing window");
9738 if (ImGui::GetIO().KeyShift)
9739 {
9740 // Display a dummy viewport (in your real app you would likely use ImageButton() to display a texture.
9741 ImVec2 avail_size = ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail();
9742 ImVec2 pos = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
9743 ImGui::ColorButton("viewport", ImVec4(0.5f, 0.2f, 0.5f, 1.0f), ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip | ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop, avail_size);
9744 ImGui::SetCursorScreenPos(ImVec2(pos.x + 10, pos.y + 10));
9745 ImGui::Text("%.2f x %.2f", avail_size.x, avail_size.y);
9746 }
9747 else
9748 {
9749 ImGui::Text("(Hold SHIFT to display a dummy viewport)");
9750 if (ImGui::IsWindowDocked())
9751 ImGui::Text("Warning: Sizing Constraints won't work if the window is docked!");
9752 if (ImGui::Button("Set 200x200")) { ImGui::SetWindowSize(ImVec2(200, 200)); } ImGui::SameLine();
9753 if (ImGui::Button("Set 500x500")) { ImGui::SetWindowSize(ImVec2(500, 500)); } ImGui::SameLine();
9754 if (ImGui::Button("Set 800x200")) { ImGui::SetWindowSize(ImVec2(800, 200)); }
9755 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 20);
9756 ImGui::Combo("Constraint", &type, test_desc, IM_ARRAYSIZE(test_desc));
9757 ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 20);
9758 ImGui::DragInt("Lines", &display_lines, 0.2f, 1, 100);
9759 ImGui::Checkbox("Auto-resize", &auto_resize);
9760 ImGui::Checkbox("Window padding", &window_padding);
9761 for (int i = 0; i < display_lines; i++)
9762 ImGui::Text("%*sHello, sailor! Making this line long enough for the example.", i * 4, "");
9763 }
9764 }
9765 ImGui::End();
9766}
ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding
@ ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding
Definition: imgui.h:1857

IMGUI_API void SetWindowSize(const ImVec2 &size, ImGuiCond cond=0)
Definition: imgui.cpp:8923

IMGUI_API bool IsWindowDocked()

参照先 ImGui::Begin(), ImGui::Button(), ImGui::Checkbox(), ImGui::ColorButton(), ImGui::Combo(), ImGuiSizeCallbackData::DesiredSize, ImGui::DragInt(), ImGui::End(), ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail(), ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos(), ImGui::GetFontSize(), ImGui::GetIO(), IM_ARRAYSIZE, IM_MAX, IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER, ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoDragDrop, ImGuiColorEditFlags_NoTooltip, ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize, ImGui::IsWindowDocked(), ImGui::PopStyleVar(), ImGui::PushStyleVar(), ImGui::SameLine(), ImGui::SetCursorScreenPos(), ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(), ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(), ImGui::SetWindowSize(), ImGui::Text(), ImGuiSizeCallbackData::UserData, ImVec2::x, ImVec2::y (計31項目).

◆ ShowExampleAppCustomRendering()

static void ShowExampleAppCustomRendering ( bool *  p_open)
static

imgui_demo.cpp の 9910 行目に定義があります。

9911{
9912 if (!ImGui::Begin("Example: Custom rendering", p_open))
9913 {
9914 ImGui::End();
9915 return;
9916 }
9917 IMGUI_DEMO_MARKER("Examples/Custom Rendering");
9918
9919 // Tip: If you do a lot of custom rendering, you probably want to use your own geometrical types and benefit of
9920 // overloaded operators, etc. Define IM_VEC2_CLASS_EXTRA in imconfig.h to create implicit conversions between your
9921 // types and ImVec2/ImVec4. Dear ImGui defines overloaded operators but they are internal to imgui.cpp and not
9922 // exposed outside (to avoid messing with your types) In this example we are not using the maths operators!
9923
9924 if (ImGui::BeginTabBar("##TabBar"))
9925 {
9926 if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Primitives"))
9927 {
9928 ImGui::PushItemWidth(-ImGui::GetFontSize() * 15);
9929 ImDrawList* draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();
9930
9931 // Draw gradients
9932 // (note that those are currently exacerbating our sRGB/Linear issues)
9933 // Calling ImGui::GetColorU32() multiplies the given colors by the current Style Alpha, but you may pass the IM_COL32() directly as well..
9934 ImGui::Text("Gradients");
9935 ImVec2 gradient_size = ImVec2(ImGui::CalcItemWidth(), ImGui::GetFrameHeight());
9936 {
9937 ImVec2 p0 = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
9938 ImVec2 p1 = ImVec2(p0.x + gradient_size.x, p0.y + gradient_size.y);
9939 ImU32 col_a = ImGui::GetColorU32(IM_COL32(0, 0, 0, 255));
9940 ImU32 col_b = ImGui::GetColorU32(IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 255));
9941 draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(p0, p1, col_a, col_b, col_b, col_a);
9942 ImGui::InvisibleButton("##gradient1", gradient_size);
9943 }
9944 {
9945 ImVec2 p0 = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
9946 ImVec2 p1 = ImVec2(p0.x + gradient_size.x, p0.y + gradient_size.y);
9947 ImU32 col_a = ImGui::GetColorU32(IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255));
9948 ImU32 col_b = ImGui::GetColorU32(IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255));
9949 draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(p0, p1, col_a, col_b, col_b, col_a);
9950 ImGui::InvisibleButton("##gradient2", gradient_size);
9951 }
9952
9953 // Draw a bunch of primitives
9954 ImGui::Text("All primitives");
9955 static float sz = 36.0f;
9956 static float thickness = 3.0f;
9957 static int ngon_sides = 6;
9958 static bool circle_segments_override = false;
9959 static int circle_segments_override_v = 12;
9960 static bool curve_segments_override = false;
9961 static int curve_segments_override_v = 8;
9962 static ImVec4 colf = ImVec4(1.0f, 1.0f, 0.4f, 1.0f);
9963 ImGui::DragFloat("Size", &sz, 0.2f, 2.0f, 100.0f, "%.0f");
9964 ImGui::DragFloat("Thickness", &thickness, 0.05f, 1.0f, 8.0f, "%.02f");
9965 ImGui::SliderInt("N-gon sides", &ngon_sides, 3, 12);
9966 ImGui::Checkbox("##circlesegmentoverride", &circle_segments_override);
9967 ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x);
9968 circle_segments_override |= ImGui::SliderInt("Circle segments override", &circle_segments_override_v, 3, 40);
9969 ImGui::Checkbox("##curvessegmentoverride", &curve_segments_override);
9970 ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x);
9971 curve_segments_override |= ImGui::SliderInt("Curves segments override", &curve_segments_override_v, 3, 40);
9972 ImGui::ColorEdit4("Color", &colf.x);
9973
9974 const ImVec2 p = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
9975 const ImU32 col = ImColor(colf);
9976 const float spacing = 10.0f;
9977 const ImDrawFlags corners_tl_br = ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopLeft | ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomRight;
9978 const float rounding = sz / 5.0f;
9979 const int circle_segments = circle_segments_override ? circle_segments_override_v : 0;
9980 const int curve_segments = curve_segments_override ? curve_segments_override_v : 0;
9981 const ImVec2 cp3[3] = { ImVec2(0.0f, sz * 0.6f), ImVec2(sz * 0.5f, -sz * 0.4f), ImVec2(sz, sz) }; // Control points for curves
9982 const ImVec2 cp4[4] = { ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f), ImVec2(sz * 1.3f, sz * 0.3f), ImVec2(sz - sz * 1.3f, sz - sz * 0.3f), ImVec2(sz, sz) };
9983
9984 float x = p.x + 4.0f;
9985 float y = p.y + 4.0f;
9986 for (int n = 0; n < 2; n++)
9987 {
9988 // First line uses a thickness of 1.0f, second line uses the configurable thickness
9989 float th = (n == 0) ? 1.0f : thickness;
9990 draw_list->AddNgon(ImVec2(x + sz*0.5f, y + sz*0.5f), sz*0.5f, col, ngon_sides, th); x += sz + spacing; // N-gon
9991 draw_list->AddCircle(ImVec2(x + sz*0.5f, y + sz*0.5f), sz*0.5f, col, circle_segments, th); x += sz + spacing; // Circle
9992 draw_list->AddEllipse(ImVec2(x + sz*0.5f, y + sz*0.5f), ImVec2(sz*0.5f, sz*0.3f), col, -0.3f, circle_segments, th); x += sz + spacing; // Ellipse
9993 draw_list->AddRect(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, 0.0f, ImDrawFlags_None, th); x += sz + spacing; // Square
9994 draw_list->AddRect(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, rounding, ImDrawFlags_None, th); x += sz + spacing; // Square with all rounded corners
9995 draw_list->AddRect(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, rounding, corners_tl_br, th); x += sz + spacing; // Square with two rounded corners
9996 draw_list->AddTriangle(ImVec2(x+sz*0.5f,y), ImVec2(x+sz, y+sz-0.5f), ImVec2(x, y+sz-0.5f), col, th);x += sz + spacing; // Triangle
9997 //draw_list->AddTriangle(ImVec2(x+sz*0.2f,y), ImVec2(x, y+sz-0.5f), ImVec2(x+sz*0.4f, y+sz-0.5f), col, th);x+= sz*0.4f + spacing; // Thin triangle
9998 PathConcaveShape(draw_list, x, y, sz); draw_list->PathStroke(col, ImDrawFlags_Closed, th); x += sz + spacing; // Concave Shape
9999 //draw_list->AddPolyline(concave_shape, IM_ARRAYSIZE(concave_shape), col, ImDrawFlags_Closed, th);
10000 draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y), col, th); x += sz + spacing; // Horizontal line (note: drawing a filled rectangle will be faster!)
10001 draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x, y + sz), col, th); x += spacing; // Vertical line (note: drawing a filled rectangle will be faster!)
10002 draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, th); x += sz + spacing; // Diagonal line
10003
10004 // Path
10005 draw_list->PathArcTo(ImVec2(x + sz*0.5f, y + sz*0.5f), sz*0.5f, 3.141592f, 3.141592f * -0.5f);
10006 draw_list->PathStroke(col, ImDrawFlags_None, th);
10007 x += sz + spacing;
10008
10009 // Quadratic Bezier Curve (3 control points)
10010 draw_list->AddBezierQuadratic(ImVec2(x + cp3[0].x, y + cp3[0].y), ImVec2(x + cp3[1].x, y + cp3[1].y), ImVec2(x + cp3[2].x, y + cp3[2].y), col, th, curve_segments);
10011 x += sz + spacing;
10012
10013 // Cubic Bezier Curve (4 control points)
10014 draw_list->AddBezierCubic(ImVec2(x + cp4[0].x, y + cp4[0].y), ImVec2(x + cp4[1].x, y + cp4[1].y), ImVec2(x + cp4[2].x, y + cp4[2].y), ImVec2(x + cp4[3].x, y + cp4[3].y), col, th, curve_segments);
10015
10016 x = p.x + 4;
10017 y += sz + spacing;
10018 }
10019
10020 // Filled shapes
10021 draw_list->AddNgonFilled(ImVec2(x + sz * 0.5f, y + sz * 0.5f), sz * 0.5f, col, ngon_sides); x += sz + spacing; // N-gon
10022 draw_list->AddCircleFilled(ImVec2(x + sz * 0.5f, y + sz * 0.5f), sz * 0.5f, col, circle_segments); x += sz + spacing; // Circle
10023 draw_list->AddEllipseFilled(ImVec2(x + sz * 0.5f, y + sz * 0.5f), ImVec2(sz * 0.5f, sz * 0.3f), col, -0.3f, circle_segments); x += sz + spacing;// Ellipse
10024 draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col); x += sz + spacing; // Square
10025 draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, 10.0f); x += sz + spacing; // Square with all rounded corners
10026 draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), col, 10.0f, corners_tl_br); x += sz + spacing; // Square with two rounded corners
10027 draw_list->AddTriangleFilled(ImVec2(x+sz*0.5f,y), ImVec2(x+sz, y+sz-0.5f), ImVec2(x, y+sz-0.5f), col); x += sz + spacing; // Triangle
10028 //draw_list->AddTriangleFilled(ImVec2(x+sz*0.2f,y), ImVec2(x, y+sz-0.5f), ImVec2(x+sz*0.4f, y+sz-0.5f), col); x += sz*0.4f + spacing; // Thin triangle
10029 PathConcaveShape(draw_list, x, y, sz); draw_list->PathFillConcave(col); x += sz + spacing; // Concave shape
10030 draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + thickness), col); x += sz + spacing; // Horizontal line (faster than AddLine, but only handle integer thickness)
10031 draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + thickness, y + sz), col); x += spacing * 2.0f;// Vertical line (faster than AddLine, but only handle integer thickness)
10032 draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + 1, y + 1), col); x += sz; // Pixel (faster than AddLine)
10033
10034 // Path
10035 draw_list->PathArcTo(ImVec2(x + sz * 0.5f, y + sz * 0.5f), sz * 0.5f, 3.141592f * -0.5f, 3.141592f);
10036 draw_list->PathFillConvex(col);
10037 x += sz + spacing;
10038
10039 // Quadratic Bezier Curve (3 control points)
10040 draw_list->PathLineTo(ImVec2(x + cp3[0].x, y + cp3[0].y));
10041 draw_list->PathBezierQuadraticCurveTo(ImVec2(x + cp3[1].x, y + cp3[1].y), ImVec2(x + cp3[2].x, y + cp3[2].y), curve_segments);
10042 draw_list->PathFillConvex(col);
10043 x += sz + spacing;
10044
10045 draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x + sz, y + sz), IM_COL32(0, 0, 0, 255), IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255), IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255), IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255));
10046 x += sz + spacing;
10047
10048 ImGui::Dummy(ImVec2((sz + spacing) * 13.2f, (sz + spacing) * 3.0f));
10049 ImGui::PopItemWidth();
10050 ImGui::EndTabItem();
10051 }
10052
10053 if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Canvas"))
10054 {
10055 static ImVector<ImVec2> points;
10056 static ImVec2 scrolling(0.0f, 0.0f);
10057 static bool opt_enable_grid = true;
10058 static bool opt_enable_context_menu = true;
10059 static bool adding_line = false;
10060
10061 ImGui::Checkbox("Enable grid", &opt_enable_grid);
10062 ImGui::Checkbox("Enable context menu", &opt_enable_context_menu);
10063 ImGui::Text("Mouse Left: drag to add lines,\nMouse Right: drag to scroll, click for context menu.");
10064
10065 // Typically you would use a BeginChild()/EndChild() pair to benefit from a clipping region + own scrolling.
10066 // Here we demonstrate that this can be replaced by simple offsetting + custom drawing + PushClipRect/PopClipRect() calls.
10067 // To use a child window instead we could use, e.g:
10068 // ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, ImVec2(0, 0)); // Disable padding
10069 // ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ChildBg, IM_COL32(50, 50, 50, 255)); // Set a background color
10070 // ImGui::BeginChild("canvas", ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f), ImGuiChildFlags_Borders, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove);
10071 // ImGui::PopStyleColor();
10072 // ImGui::PopStyleVar();
10073 // [...]
10074 // ImGui::EndChild();
10075
10076 // Using InvisibleButton() as a convenience 1) it will advance the layout cursor and 2) allows us to use IsItemHovered()/IsItemActive()
10077 ImVec2 canvas_p0 = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos(); // ImDrawList API uses screen coordinates!
10078 ImVec2 canvas_sz = ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail(); // Resize canvas to what's available
10079 if (canvas_sz.x < 50.0f) canvas_sz.x = 50.0f;
10080 if (canvas_sz.y < 50.0f) canvas_sz.y = 50.0f;
10081 ImVec2 canvas_p1 = ImVec2(canvas_p0.x + canvas_sz.x, canvas_p0.y + canvas_sz.y);
10082
10083 // Draw border and background color
10084 ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
10085 ImDrawList* draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();
10086 draw_list->AddRectFilled(canvas_p0, canvas_p1, IM_COL32(50, 50, 50, 255));
10087 draw_list->AddRect(canvas_p0, canvas_p1, IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 255));
10088
10089 // This will catch our interactions
10090 ImGui::InvisibleButton("canvas", canvas_sz, ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonLeft | ImGuiButtonFlags_MouseButtonRight);
10091 const bool is_hovered = ImGui::IsItemHovered(); // Hovered
10092 const bool is_active = ImGui::IsItemActive(); // Held
10093 const ImVec2 origin(canvas_p0.x + scrolling.x, canvas_p0.y + scrolling.y); // Lock scrolled origin
10094 const ImVec2 mouse_pos_in_canvas(io.MousePos.x - origin.x, io.MousePos.y - origin.y);
10095
10096 // Add first and second point
10097 if (is_hovered && !adding_line && ImGui::IsMouseClicked(ImGuiMouseButton_Left))
10098 {
10099 points.push_back(mouse_pos_in_canvas);
10100 points.push_back(mouse_pos_in_canvas);
10101 adding_line = true;
10102 }
10103 if (adding_line)
10104 {
10105 points.back() = mouse_pos_in_canvas;
10106 if (!ImGui::IsMouseDown(ImGuiMouseButton_Left))
10107 adding_line = false;
10108 }
10109
10110 // Pan (we use a zero mouse threshold when there's no context menu)
10111 // You may decide to make that threshold dynamic based on whether the mouse is hovering something etc.
10112 const float mouse_threshold_for_pan = opt_enable_context_menu ? -1.0f : 0.0f;
10113 if (is_active && ImGui::IsMouseDragging(ImGuiMouseButton_Right, mouse_threshold_for_pan))
10114 {
10115 scrolling.x += io.MouseDelta.x;
10116 scrolling.y += io.MouseDelta.y;
10117 }
10118
10119 // Context menu (under default mouse threshold)
10120 ImVec2 drag_delta = ImGui::GetMouseDragDelta(ImGuiMouseButton_Right);
10121 if (opt_enable_context_menu && drag_delta.x == 0.0f && drag_delta.y == 0.0f)
10122 ImGui::OpenPopupOnItemClick("context", ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonRight);
10123 if (ImGui::BeginPopup("context"))
10124 {
10125 if (adding_line)
10126 points.resize(points.size() - 2);
10127 adding_line = false;
10128 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Remove one", NULL, false, points.Size > 0)) { points.resize(points.size() - 2); }
10129 if (ImGui::MenuItem("Remove all", NULL, false, points.Size > 0)) { points.clear(); }
10130 ImGui::EndPopup();
10131 }
10132
10133 // Draw grid + all lines in the canvas
10134 draw_list->PushClipRect(canvas_p0, canvas_p1, true);
10135 if (opt_enable_grid)
10136 {
10137 const float GRID_STEP = 64.0f;
10138 for (float x = fmodf(scrolling.x, GRID_STEP); x < canvas_sz.x; x += GRID_STEP)
10139 draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(canvas_p0.x + x, canvas_p0.y), ImVec2(canvas_p0.x + x, canvas_p1.y), IM_COL32(200, 200, 200, 40));
10140 for (float y = fmodf(scrolling.y, GRID_STEP); y < canvas_sz.y; y += GRID_STEP)
10141 draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(canvas_p0.x, canvas_p0.y + y), ImVec2(canvas_p1.x, canvas_p0.y + y), IM_COL32(200, 200, 200, 40));
10142 }
10143 for (int n = 0; n < points.Size; n += 2)
10144 draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(origin.x + points[n].x, origin.y + points[n].y), ImVec2(origin.x + points[n + 1].x, origin.y + points[n + 1].y), IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255), 2.0f);
10145 draw_list->PopClipRect();
10146
10147 ImGui::EndTabItem();
10148 }
10149
10150 if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("BG/FG draw lists"))
10151 {
10152 static bool draw_bg = true;
10153 static bool draw_fg = true;
10154 ImGui::Checkbox("Draw in Background draw list", &draw_bg);
10155 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("The Background draw list will be rendered below every Dear ImGui windows.");
10156 ImGui::Checkbox("Draw in Foreground draw list", &draw_fg);
10157 ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("The Foreground draw list will be rendered over every Dear ImGui windows.");
10158 ImVec2 window_pos = ImGui::GetWindowPos();
10159 ImVec2 window_size = ImGui::GetWindowSize();
10160 ImVec2 window_center = ImVec2(window_pos.x + window_size.x * 0.5f, window_pos.y + window_size.y * 0.5f);
10161 if (draw_bg)
10162 ImGui::GetBackgroundDrawList()->AddCircle(window_center, window_size.x * 0.6f, IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 200), 0, 10 + 4);
10163 if (draw_fg)
10164 ImGui::GetForegroundDrawList()->AddCircle(window_center, window_size.y * 0.6f, IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 200), 0, 10);
10165 ImGui::EndTabItem();
10166 }
10167
10168 // Demonstrate out-of-order rendering via channels splitting
10169 // We use functions in ImDrawList as each draw list contains a convenience splitter,
10170 // but you can also instantiate your own ImDrawListSplitter if you need to nest them.
10171 if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Draw Channels"))
10172 {
10173 ImDrawList* draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();
10174 {
10175 ImGui::Text("Blue shape is drawn first: appears in back");
10176 ImGui::Text("Red shape is drawn after: appears in front");
10177 ImVec2 p0 = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
10178 draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(p0.x, p0.y), ImVec2(p0.x + 50, p0.y + 50), IM_COL32(0, 0, 255, 255)); // Blue
10179 draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(p0.x + 25, p0.y + 25), ImVec2(p0.x + 75, p0.y + 75), IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255)); // Red
10180 ImGui::Dummy(ImVec2(75, 75));
10181 }
10182 ImGui::Separator();
10183 {
10184 ImGui::Text("Blue shape is drawn first, into channel 1: appears in front");
10185 ImGui::Text("Red shape is drawn after, into channel 0: appears in back");
10186 ImVec2 p1 = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
10187
10188 // Create 2 channels and draw a Blue shape THEN a Red shape.
10189 // You can create any number of channels. Tables API use 1 channel per column in order to better batch draw calls.
10190 draw_list->ChannelsSplit(2);
10191 draw_list->ChannelsSetCurrent(1);
10192 draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(p1.x, p1.y), ImVec2(p1.x + 50, p1.y + 50), IM_COL32(0, 0, 255, 255)); // Blue
10193 draw_list->ChannelsSetCurrent(0);
10194 draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(p1.x + 25, p1.y + 25), ImVec2(p1.x + 75, p1.y + 75), IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255)); // Red
10195
10196 // Flatten/reorder channels. Red shape is in channel 0 and it appears below the Blue shape in channel 1.
10197 // This works by copying draw indices only (vertices are not copied).
10198 draw_list->ChannelsMerge();
10199 ImGui::Dummy(ImVec2(75, 75));
10200 ImGui::Text("After reordering, contents of channel 0 appears below channel 1.");
10201 }
10202 ImGui::EndTabItem();
10203 }
10204
10205 ImGui::EndTabBar();
10206 }
10207
10208 ImGui::End();
10209}
